SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
	select value_in_use from master.sys.configurations where configuration_id = 1562   /* name = 'clr enabled' */
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */

   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
	select @counter = count(*) from master.sys.configurations where configuration_id = 16385 /*In SQL 2012, this parameter doesnot exists */
	if @counter &lt;&gt; 0
		select value_in_use from master.sys.configurations where configuration_id = 16385   /* comment = 'Enable or disable SQL Mail XPs' */
	else
		select 0	
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */
end</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
    if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 (
					 proxy_id  int,
					 proxy_name  varchar(255),
					 flags  int,
					 name  varchar(255),
					 sid  varchar(255),
					 principal_id  varchar(255))
	end
    insert into #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 exec msdb.dbo.sp_enum_login_for_proxy	

    select count(distinct proxy_name) from #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 where lower(name) = 'public'
	/*If count return 0 then pass, anything is fail mean public login is enable for SQL proxy account*/

    drop table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1
	       
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */
end</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
    if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 (
					 proxy_id  int,
					 proxy_name  varchar(255),
					 flags  int,
					 name  varchar(255),
					 sid  varchar(255),
					 principal_id  varchar(255))
	end
    insert into #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 exec msdb.dbo.sp_enum_login_for_proxy	

    select distinct 'Proxy_name= ' + proxy_name from #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1 where lower(name) = 'public'
	

    drop table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy1
	       
end

        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int,
        @counter int
SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
   select @counter=count(*) from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 16389
   if @counter &gt; 0 
   begin
	   select value from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 16389		/* name = 'Web Assistant procedures' */
   end	   
   else
	   select 0       
end

	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2008</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2008</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action require.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that two or more proxy accounts should not share the same login.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">As recommended, we did not find any login name that are used more than once for proxy accounts.  If you are running MSSQL 2000 and older, this test does not apply.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Our test detected that there are login(s) use by more than one proxy accounts.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
    if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2 (
					 proxy_id  int,
					 proxy_name  varchar(255),
					 flags  int,
					 name  varchar(255),
					 sid  varchar(255),
					 principal_id  varchar(255))
	end
	
	if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_DM6140_temp%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_DM6140_temp (
					 login_name  varchar(255),
					 number_of_use int)
	end
	
    insert into #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2   exec msdb.dbo.sp_enum_login_for_proxy

	insert into #GDM_DM6140_temp (login_name, number_of_use) 
	select name, count(*) from #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2
	where flags = 0
	group by name
	having count(name) &gt; 1

	select count(*) from #GDM_DM6140_temp

	drop table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2

	drop table #GDM_DM6140_temp

	       
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */
end</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Login that are used with more than one proxy:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
    if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2 (
					 proxy_id  int,
					 proxy_name  varchar(255),
					 flags  int,
					 name  varchar(255),
					 sid  varchar(255),
					 principal_id  varchar(255))
	end
	
	if not exists (select * from tempdb.sys.all_objects where name like '#GDM_DM6140_temp%' and type = 'U')
	begin	 
		create table #GDM_DM6140_temp (
					 login_name  varchar(255),
					 number_of_use int)
	end
	
    insert into #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2   exec msdb.dbo.sp_enum_login_for_proxy

	insert into #GDM_DM6140_temp (login_name, number_of_use) 
	select name, count(*) from #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2
	where flags = 0
	group by name
	having count(name) &gt; 1

	select 'Proxy_name=' + b.proxy_name +
	       '  Login_name=' + a.login_name +
	       '  Number_of_usage=' + cast(a.number_of_use as varchar(3)) from #GDM_DM6140_temp a, #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2 b where a.login_name = b.name 

	drop table #GDM_sp_enum_login_for_proxy2

	drop table #GDM_DM6140_temp

	       
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	select 0		/* Cannot use text, has to give some number */
end</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int,
        @HasThisFeature int
SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end
/*In this test, unlike other.  1 = pass, 0 = fail.  We want the user to enable this feature.*/
if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
	if @dbnumber = 9 and substring(@dbversion,6,4) &gt;= 3042
	begin
		/*We are only testing this if it is SQL 2005 SP2 or higher.  SP2 = 3042*/
		select @HasThisFeature = count(*) from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 1577
		if @HasThisFeature &gt; 0
		begin
			select value from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 1577		/*name like 'common criteria compliance enabled'*/   
		end	
		else
			/*If This option doesnot exists, we are passing the test */
			select 1
	end
	if @dbnumber = 9 and substring(@dbversion,6,4) &lt; 3042
	begin
		/*If it is not SP2 or higher, we pass because it is not valid test.*/
		select 1
	end	
	if @dbnumber &gt;= 10 
	begin
		select @HasThisFeature = count(*) from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 1577
		if @HasThisFeature &gt; 0
		begin
			select value from sys.configurations where configuration_id = 1577		/*name like 'common criteria compliance enabled'*/   
		end
		else
			/*If This option doesnot exists, we are passing the test */
			select 1
	end        
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
				/*This mean it is SQL 2000 or lower, we pass because it is not valid test.*/
	select 1		/*Cannot use text, has to give some number*/
end</field>

		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">1</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">You should enable SEC_CASE_SENSITIVE_LOGON.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">SEC_CASE_SENSITIVE_LOGON is enabled, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">SEC_CASE_SENSITIVE_LOGON is disabled.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nver	number;
	retval	integer := 0;
	sver	varchar2(255) := '';
	strval	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select VERSION
	into sver
	from V$INSTANCE;

	nver := to_number(substr(sver,1,(instr(sver,'.',1,2) - 1)));

	if nver &gt;= 11.1 then

		select VALUE
		into strval
		from V$PARAMETER
		where NAME = 'sec_case_sensitive_logon';

	end if;

	if (nver &lt; 11.1 or strval = 'TRUE') then
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nval 	integer := 0;
	nver	number;
	retval	integer := 0;
	sver	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select VERSION
	into sver
	from V$INSTANCE;

	nver := to_number(substr(sver,1,(instr(sver,'.',1,2) - 1)));

	if nver &gt;= 11.1 then

		select to_number(VALUE)
		into nval
		from V$PARAMETER
		where NAME = 'sec_max_failed_login_attempts';

	end if;

	if nver &lt; 11.1 then
		retval := 0;
	else
		if nval &gt; 0 and nval &lt; 11 then
			retval := 0;
		else
			retval := 1;
		end if;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nver	number;
	retval	integer := 0;
	sver	varchar2(255) := '';
	strval	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select VERSION
	into sver
	from V$INSTANCE;

	nver := to_number(substr(sver,1,(instr(sver,'.',1,2) - 1)));

	if nver &gt;= 11.1 then

		select VALUE
		into strval
		from V$PARAMETER
		where NAME = 'sec_protocol_error_further_action';

	end if;

/*	if (nver &lt; 11.1 or upper(strval) = 'DROP' or upper(strval) = 'DELAY') then */
	if (nver &lt; 11.1 or instr(upper(strval),'DROP') &gt; 0 or instr(upper(strval),'DELAY') &gt; 0) then 
	
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">You should set SEC_PROTOCOL_ERROR_TRACE_ACTION to TRACE, LOG, or ALERT</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">SEC_PROTOCOL_ERROR_TRACE_ACTION is set to TRACE, LOG, or ALERT, as recommended, or your version of Oracle does not support the SEC_PROTOCOL_ERROR_TRACE_ACTION parameter.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">SEC_PROTOCOL_ERROR_TRACE_ACTION is set to a value other than TRACE, LOG, or ALERT.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nver	number;
	retval	integer := 0;
	sver	varchar2(255) := '';
	strval	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select VERSION
	into sver
	from V$INSTANCE;

	nver := to_number(substr(sver,1,(instr(sver,'.',1,2) - 1)));

	if nver &gt;= 11.1 then

		select VALUE
		into strval
		from V$PARAMETER
		where NAME = 'sec_protocol_error_trace_action';

	end if;

	if (nver &lt; 11.1 or upper(strval) = 'TRACE' or upper(strval) = 'LOG' or upper(strval) = 'ALERT') then
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2019</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2019</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Restrict DBA roles to use for DBA functions. Revoke any privileges outside of the DBA role and the UNLIMITED TABLESPACE privilege.   From custom DBA users.  You can use the following command to revoke the role privilege:  REVOKE &lt;privilege&gt; FROM &lt;grantee&gt;. To exclude authorized privilege Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Administrative privileges are restricted, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more unauthorized administrative privileges have been granted to DBA grantees.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nval 	integer := 0;
	retval	integer := 0;

	cursor curDBA_ROLE_PRIVS is
		select 1
		from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
		where GRANTEE in (
			select GRANTEE
			from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
			where GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA'
			and GRANTEE not in ('SYS','SYSTEM','SYSMAN')
			)
		and GRANTED_ROLE not in ('CONNECT');

	cursor curDBA_SYS_PRIVS is
		select 1
		from DBA_SYS_PRIVS
		where GRANTEE in (
			select GRANTEE from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
			where GRANTED_ROLE='DBA'
			and GRANTEE not in ('SYS','SYSTEM','SYSMAN')
			)
		and PRIVILEGE &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED TABLESPACE';

begin

	nval := 0;

	open curDBA_ROLE_PRIVS;
	fetch curDBA_ROLE_PRIVS
	into nval;
	close curDBA_ROLE_PRIVS;

	if nval &gt; 0 then
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	nval := 0;

	open curDBA_SYS_PRIVS;
	fetch curDBA_SYS_PRIVS
	into nval;
	close curDBA_SYS_PRIVS;

	if nval &gt; 0 then
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants of admin privileges:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Grantee = ' || GRANTEE || ' : Granted_Role = ' || GRANTED_ROLE  
from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
where GRANTEE in (
	select GRANTEE
	from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
	where GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA'
	and GRANTEE not in ('SYS','SYSTEM','SYSMAN')
	)
and GRANTED_ROLE not in ('CONNECT')
union
select 'Grantee = ' ||  GRANTEE || ' : Privilege = ' || PRIVILEGE 
from DBA_SYS_PRIVS
where GRANTEE in (
	select GRANTEE from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
	where GRANTED_ROLE='DBA'
	and GRANTEE not in ('SYS','SYSTEM','SYSMAN')
	)
and PRIVILEGE &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED TABLESPACE'
order by 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2020</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2020</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">You should review users' default and temporary tablespace assignments, changing them as necessary.  Create and dedicate tablespaces to support only on application.  You can alter user tablespace by running the example command: ALTER USER &lt;USER_NAME&gt; DEFAULT TABLESPACE &lt;TABLESPACE_NAME&gt;.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The SYSTEM tablespace is used only for system objects, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more non-management users has been assigned the SYSTEM tablespace as his/her default or temporary tablespace.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nval 	integer := 0;
	retval	integer := 0;

	cursor curDBA_USERS is
		select 1
		from DBA_USERS
		where	(DEFAULT_TABLESPACE = 'SYSTEM' or TEMPORARY_TABLESPACE = 'SYSTEM')
		and		USERNAME not in (
			'AURORA$JIS$UTILITY$',
			'AURORA$ORB$UNAUTHENTICATED',
			'DBSNMP',
			'MDSYS',
			'ORDPLUGINS',
			'ORDSYS',
			'OSE$HTTP$ADMIN',
			'OUTLN',
			'REPADMIN',
			'SYS',
			'SYSTEM',
			'TRACESVR',
			'MTSSYS',
			'DIP',
			'LBACSYS',
			'MGMT_VIEW'
			);

begin

	open curDBA_USERS;
	fetch curDBA_USERS
	into nval;
	close curDBA_USERS;

	if nval = 0 then
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Bad default tablespace assignments:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select USERNAME
from DBA_USERS
where (DEFAULT_TABLESPACE = 'SYSTEM' or TEMPORARY_TABLESPACE = 'SYSTEM')
and  USERNAME not in (
	'AURORA$JIS$UTILITY$',
	'AURORA$ORB$UNAUTHENTICATED',
	'DBSNMP',
	'MDSYS',
	'ORDPLUGINS',
	'ORDSYS',
	'OSE$HTTP$ADMIN',
	'OUTLN',
	'REPADMIN',
	'SYS',
	'SYSTEM',
	'TRACESVR',
	'MTSSYS',
	'DIP',
	'LBACSYS',
	'MGMT_VIEW'
	)</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2021</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2021</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">You should revoke PUBLIC access to critical packages.  You can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE EXECUTE ON &lt;schema&gt;.&lt;package_name&gt; FROM PUBLIC.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Access to critical packages is restricted from PUBLIC, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">PUBLIC access to one or more critical packages has been granted.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nval 	integer := 0;
	retval	integer := 0;

	cursor curDBA_USERS is
		select 1
		from DBA_TAB_PRIVS
		where	GRANTEE ='PUBLIC'
		and		PRIVILEGE ='EXECUTE'
		and		TABLE_NAME in (
			'UTL_FILE',
			'UTL_SMTP',
			'UTL_TCP',
			'UTL_HTTP',
			'DBMS_RANDOM',
			'DBMS_LOB',
			'DBMS_SQL',
			'DBMS_SYS_SQL',
			'DBMS_JOB',
			'DBMS_BACKUP_RESTORE',
			'DBMS_OBFUSCATION_TOOLKIT'
			);

begin

	open curDBA_USERS;
	fetch curDBA_USERS
	into nval;
	close curDBA_USERS;

	if nval = 0 then
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants causing failure</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select DISTINCT TABLE_NAME
from DBA_TAB_PRIVS
where	GRANTEE ='PUBLIC'
and		PRIVILEGE ='EXECUTE'
and		TABLE_NAME in (
	'UTL_FILE',
	'UTL_SMTP',
	'UTL_TCP',
	'UTL_HTTP',
	'DBMS_RANDOM',
	'DBMS_LOB',
	'DBMS_SQL',
	'DBMS_SYS_SQL',
	'DBMS_JOB',
	'DBMS_BACKUP_RESTORE',
	'DBMS_OBFUSCATION_TOOLKIT'
	)
order by 1</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	retval	integer := 0;
	strval	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select INSTANCE_NAME
	into strval
	from V$INSTANCE;

	if strval = 'ORCL' then
		retval := 1;
	else
		retval := 0;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review our finding using the query provided here.  You should Revoke the GRANT option from all object privileges.  To revoke privilege from grantee, use this reference command: REVOKE [privilege] ON [database].[object_name] FROM [grantee].  We have seen in certain environments that this test can generate in excess of 100,000 rows of results.  That is too large for meaningful interpretation.  Because of this we provided the query where you can execute this in a Teradata Studio to examine the result further and not to display the results in the details section.  QUERY: locking view dbc.allrights for access locking view dbc.tables for access select top 100 r.username as Grantee, r.DatabaseName, r.TableName, r.AccessRight from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t where t.tablename = r.tablename and t.databasename = r.databasename and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All' and upper(r.username) not in ('SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'DEFAULT', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SQLGUARD', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and r.databasename &lt;&gt; r.username and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName and GrantAuthority = 'Y';</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No object privileges have been granted with the GRANT option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more objects have been granted using GRANT option.  When object privileges are granted using the GRANT option, a user can grant privileges on that object to other users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.tables for access
select count(*)
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t
where t.tablename = r.tablename   
and t.databasename = r.databasename
and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All'
and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */
and r.databasename &lt;&gt; r.username            					/* The grantee is not same as databasename */
and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName             					/* The grantee is not same as creator */
and GrantAuthority = 'Y'
;</field>

Having it set to &lt; 3 will cause the account to lock too often.  The default threshold value for this test is 3, but it can be customized.  You can update this parameter by running this query: UPDATE DBC.SysSecDefaults SET MaxLogonAttempts = 3 WHERE PrimeIndex = 1; System restart is require to activate revised password control.</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review our finding using the query provided here.  We recommend that you grant privileges to roles instead of to individual users or databases.  To revoke privilege from grantee, use this reference command: REVOKE [privilege] ON [database] FROM [grantee].  We have seen in certain environments that this test can generate in excess of 100,000 rows of results.  That is too large for meaningful interpretation.  Because of this we provided the query where you can execute this in a Teradata Studio to examine the result further and not to display the results in the details section.  QUERY:	locking view dbc.allrights for access locking view dbc.databases for access select top 100 * from (select r.username as Grantee, r.DatabaseName, r.AccessRight from dbc.allrights r where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All' and r.tablename = 'All' and r.username &lt;&gt; r.databasename  and upper(r.username) not in ('SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD', 'BARUSER', 'EXTERNAL_AP') and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName union select r.username as Grantee, r.DatabaseName, r.AccessRight from dbc.allrights r, dbc.databases d where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All' and d.DatabaseName = r.databaseName  and d.dbkind = 'U' and r.tablename = 'All' and r.username =  r.databasename and upper(r.username) not in ('SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD', 'BARUSER', 'EXTERNAL_AP') and r.accessright not in ('CA', 'CG', 'CM', 'CP', 'CT', 'CV', 'D', 'DA', 'DF', 'DG', 'DM', 'DP', 'DT', 'DV', 'E', 'I', 'PD', 'R', 'RS', 'U', 'ST') and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName) as limit_detail;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No system privileges are granted directly to users or databases, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more system privileges have been granted directly to individual users or databases.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.databases for access
select sum(total) from 
(
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r
where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All'								/* Exclude all username type. */
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* This mean system privilege not object privilege */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.databasename     						/* We want to get all the database privileged granted  to  the user  outside of its own DB. */
      and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
union all
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.databases d 
where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All'           							/* Exclude all username type. */ 
and d.DatabaseName = r.databaseName 
and d.dbkind = 'U' 
and r.tablename = 'All'         							/* This mean system privilege not object privilege */ 
and r.username =  r.databasename                					/* We want to get all the database privileged granted  to  the user  within the database. */ 
and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)			/* exclude system database grantee */		
and r.accessright not in ('CA', 'CG', 'CM', 'CP', 'CT', 'CV', 'D',
                          'DA', 'DF', 'DG', 'DM', 'DP', 'DT', 'DV',
                          'E', 'I', 'PD', 'R', 'RS', 'U', 'ST') 
and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
) as total_count;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.databases for access
select 'We found ' || trim(sum(total)) ||  ' database privileges granted to users and databases directly.  To see these detail please execute query provided in the recommendation text outside of Guardium applicance.'
from 
(
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r
where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All'								/* Exclude all username type. */
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* This mean system privilege not object privilege */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.databasename     						/* We want to get all the database privileged granted  to  the user  outside of its own DB. */
      and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
union all
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.databases d 
where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All'           							/* Exclude all username type. */ 
and d.DatabaseName = r.databaseName 
and d.dbkind = 'U' 
and r.tablename = 'All'         							/* This mean system privilege not object privilege */ 
and r.username =  r.databasename                					/* We want to get all the database privileged granted  to  the user  within the database. */ 
and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)			/* exclude system database grantee */		
and r.accessright not in ('CA', 'CG', 'CM', 'CP', 'CT', 'CV', 'D',
                          'DA', 'DF', 'DG', 'DM', 'DP', 'DT', 'DV',
                          'E', 'I', 'PD', 'R', 'RS', 'U', 'ST') 
and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
) as total_count;</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend revoking these privileges from PUBLIC.  For best practice, it is not good to grant any privilges to PUBLIC.  A predefined group name &quot;Teradata Allowed Grants to Public&quot; is shipped with this test to exclude default grants from Teradata.  You can use this exception group or clone it to add additional exception members then link your group to this test.  To remove a grant from public, run the following sample command:  REVOKE ALL ON DB_NAME.OBJECT_NAME FROM PUBLIC;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Object privileges are not granted to PUBLIC, as recommended.</field>

where t.tablename = r.tablename   
      and t.databasename = r.databasename
      and r.username = 'PUBLIC'
      and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All'</field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2046</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2046</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review our finding using the query provided here.  You should limited or revoke grants of system privileges on system databases.  To revoke privilege from grantee, use this reference command: REVOKE [privilege] ON [database] FROM [grantee].  We have seen in certain environments that this test can generate in excess of 100,000 rows of results.  That is too large for meaningful interpretation.  Because of this we provided the query where you can execute this in a Teradata Studio to examine the result further and not to display the results in the details section.  QUERY:	locking view dbc.allrights for access locking view dbc.allrolerights for access locking view dbc.rolemembers for access select top 100 * from ( select 'Grantee=' ||trim(r.username) ||  ' : Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || ' : AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright) as col1 from dbc.allrights r where r.username &lt;&gt; 'All' and r.tablename = 'All' and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName and upper(r.username) not in  ('SQLJ', 'PUBLIC','TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and upper(r.databasename) in ('SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') union select 'Grantee=' ||trim(m.Grantee) || ' : RoleName=' || trim(m.rolename) || ' : Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || ' : AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright) as col1 from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m where r.rolename = m.rolename and upper(r.databaseName) in ( 'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and upper(m.grantee) not in ('SQLJ', 'PUBLIC', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'DEFAULT', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SQLGUARD', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and r.tablename = 'All') AS limit_detail;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">System privileges are not granted to users and databases on system databases.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">System privileges have been granted to users or databases on system databases.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.allrolerights for access
locking view dbc.rolemembers for access
select sum(total) from 
(
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r
where r.username not in ('All', 'PUBLIC')						/* exclude All grantee type. */
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* system privileges type only.  Exclude object privileges */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
      and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */
      and upper(r.databasename)  in  (							/* check for system database granted only.*/
      	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
      	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
	'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')
union all
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m
where r.rolename = m.rolename
      and upper(r.databaseName) in (							/* check for system database  granted only. */
      'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
      'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
      'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')
      and upper(m.grantee) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database  as grantee */	
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* exclude system object privileges type. */
) as total_count
;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.allrolerights for access
locking view dbc.rolemembers for access
select 'We found ' || trim(sum(total)) ||  ' System privileges granted to users and databases.  To see these detail please execute query provided in the recommendation text outside of Guardium applicance.'
from 
(
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrights r
where r.username not in ('All', 'PUBLIC')						/* exclude All grantee type. */
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* system privileges type only.  Exclude object privileges */
      and r.UserName &lt;&gt; r.CreatorName          						/* Grantee not equal to Creator */ 
      and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */
      and upper(r.databasename)  in  (							/* check for system database granted only.*/
      	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
      	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
	'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')
union all
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m
where r.rolename = m.rolename
      and upper(r.databaseName) in (							/* check for system database  granted only. */
      'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
      'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
      'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')
      and upper(m.grantee) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database  as grantee */	
      and r.tablename = 'All'								/* exclude system object privileges type. */
) as total_count
;</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2047</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2047</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review our finding using the query provided here.  You should limited or revoke grants of object privileges on system databases.  To revoke privilege from grantee, use this reference command: REVOKE [privilege] ON [database].[object_name] FROM [grantee].  We have seen in certain environments that this test can generate in excess of 100,000 rows of results.  That is too large for meaningful interpretation.  Because of this we provided the query where you can execute this in a Teradata Studio to examine the result further and not to display the results in the details section.  QUERY: locking view dbc.allrights for access locking view dbc.tables for access locking view dbc.allrolerights for access locking view dbc.rolemembers for access select top 100 * from (select 'Grantee=' ||trim(r.username) || ' : Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || '.' || trim(r.tablename) || ' : AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright) as col1 from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t where t.tablename = r.tablename and t.databasename = r.databasename and upper(r.username) not in ('SQLJ', 'PUBLIC','TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and r.username &lt;&gt; 'All' and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All' and upper(r.databasename) in ('SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') union select 'Grantee=' ||trim(m.Grantee) || ' : RoleName=' || trim(m.rolename) || ' : Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || '.' || trim(r.tablename) || ' : AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright) as col1 from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m, dbc.tables t where r.rolename = m.rolename and t.tablename = r.tablename and t.databasename = r.databasename and upper(r.databaseName) in ( 'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and upper(m.grantee) not in  ('SQLJ', 'PUBLIC', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'DEFAULT', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC', 'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB', 'ALL', 'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SQLGUARD', 'TDQCD', 'SYSUIF', 'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD') and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All' and r.rolename &lt;&gt; 'gdmmonitor' ) AS limit_detail;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No object privileges have been granted to users and databases on system databases, as recommended,</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more unauthorized object privileges have been granted to either users, databases or roles on system databases.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.tables for access
locking view dbc.allrolerights for access
locking view dbc.rolemembers for access
select sum(total) from
(
select count(*)	as total
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t
where t.tablename = r.tablename	
and t.databasename = r.databasename
and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */	     
and r.username not in ('All', 'PUBLIC')						/* exclude All grantee type. */
and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All'            						/* exclude system privileges type. */
and upper(r.databasename)  in  (						/* check for system database granted only.*/
	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
	'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')
union all
select count(*) as total
from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m, dbc.tables t
where r.rolename = m.rolename
      and t.tablename = r.tablename	
      and t.databasename = r.databasename					/* check for system database  granted only. */
      and upper(r.databaseName) in (		
	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
	'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')		
      and upper(m.grantee) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)	/* exclude system database  as grantee */		      
      and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All'							/* exclude system privileges type. */
      and r.rolename &lt;&gt; 'gdmmonitor'
) as total_count
;</field>

select 'We found ' || trim(sum(total)) ||  ' System database objects granted to users or databases.  To see these detail please execute query provided in the recommendation text outside of Guardium applicance.'
from
(
select count(*)	as total
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t
where t.tablename = r.tablename	
and t.databasename = r.databasename
and upper(r.username) not in (~~G~Teradata exclude default grantees~~)		/* exclude system database grantee */	     
and r.username not in ('All', 'PUBLIC')  					/* exclude All grantee type. */
and r.tablename &lt;&gt; 'All'            						/* exclude system privileges type. */
and upper(r.databasename)  in  (						/* check for system database granted only.*/
	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',
	'DBCMNGR', 'LOCKLOGSHREDDER', 'SYSBAR', 'SYSJDBC', 'TD_SERVER_DB', 'TD_SYSXML', 'TDQCD')

from dbc.allrolerights r, dbc.rolemembers m, dbc.tables t
where r.rolename = m.rolename
      and t.tablename = r.tablename	
      and t.databasename = r.databasename					/* check for system database  granted only. */
      and upper(r.databaseName) in (		
	'SQLJ', 'TDPUSER', 'SYSADMIN', 'SYS_CALENDAR', 'SYSTEMFE', 'CRASHDUMPS', 'SYSLIB', 'DBC',
	'EXTUSER', 'SYSUDTLIB',	'SYSSPATIAL', 'TDWM', 'TDSTATS', 'TD_SYSFNLIB', 'SYSUIF',

QUERY:	locking view dbc.allrights for access locking view dbc.tables for access select  'Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || ':AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright) from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t where t.tablename = r.tablename and r.username = 'PUBLIC' and r.tablename = 'All';</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.tables for access

from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t
where t.tablename = r.tablename   
      and r.username = 'PUBLIC'
      and r.tablename = 'All'
;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">System privileges granted to PUBLIC:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">locking view dbc.allrights for access
locking view dbc.tables for access
select  'Database=' || trim(r.databasename) || ':AccessRight=' || trim(r.accessright)
from dbc.allrights r, dbc.tables t
where t.tablename = r.tablename   
      and r.username = 'PUBLIC'

		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2049</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2049</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review the list of privileges granted with the GRANT option to users and/or groups and revoke the GRANT option.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Admin privileges are granted without the GRANT option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Admin privileges have been granted with the GRANT option to users or groups.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select (
	select count(*)
	from _V_USER_PRIV
	where UOPGADMPRIV &gt; 0
	) +	(
	select count(*)
	from _V_GROUP_PRIV
	where GOPGADMPRIV &gt; 0
	) as total_rows</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Users and/or groups having prvileges with GRANT option:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select USERNAME || ' (User) Database ' || DATABASENAME || ': ' || X1 || X2 || X3 || X4 || X5 || X6 || X7 || X8 || X9 || X10 || X11 || X12 || X13 ||  X14 || X15 || X16 || X17 || X18 || X19 || X20 || X21 || X22 || X23 || X24 || X25 || X26 || X27 || X28
from (
	select	USERNAME as &quot;USERNAME&quot;,
			DATABASENAME as &quot;DATABASENAME&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X1&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X2&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'U' else '' end) AS &quot;X3&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X4&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'V' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'I' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 't' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'P' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'Q' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'F' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'O' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'r' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'M' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'c' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'e' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 131072) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X18&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 262144) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X19&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 1048576) &gt; 0 then 'u' else '' end) AS &quot;X20&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 2097152) &gt; 0 then 'Y' else '' end) AS &quot;X21&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 4194304) &gt; 0 then 'S' else '' end) AS &quot;X22&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 8388608) &gt; 0 then 'H' else '' end) AS &quot;X23&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 16777216) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X24&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 33554432) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X25&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 67108864) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X26&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 134217728) &gt; 0 then 'N' else '' end) AS &quot;X27&quot;,
			(case when (UOPGADMPRIV &amp; 268435456) &gt; 0 then 's' else '' end) AS &quot;X28&quot;
	FROM _V_USER_PRIV
	WHERE UOPGADMPRIV &gt; 0
	) as BLAH
UNION
select GROUPNAME || ' (Group) Database '  || DATABASENAME || ': ' || X1 || X2 || X3 || X4 || X5 || X6 || X7 || X8 || X9 || X10 || X11 || X12 || X13 ||  X14 || X15 || X16 || X17 || X18 || X19 || X20 || X21 || X22 || X23 || X24 || X25 || X26 || X27 || X28
from (
	select	GROUPNAME as &quot;GROUPNAME&quot;,
			DATABASENAME as &quot;DATABASENAME&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X1&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X2&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'U' else '' end) AS &quot;X3&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X4&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'V' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'I' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 't' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'P' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'Q' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'F' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'O' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'r' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'M' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'c' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'e' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 131072) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X18&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 262144) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X19&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 1048576) &gt; 0 then 'u' else '' end) AS &quot;X20&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 2097152) &gt; 0 then 'Y' else '' end) AS &quot;X21&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 4194304) &gt; 0 then 'S' else '' end) AS &quot;X22&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 8388608) &gt; 0 then 'H' else '' end) AS &quot;X23&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 16777216) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X24&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 33554432) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X25&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 67108864) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X26&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 134217728) &gt; 0 then 'N' else '' end) AS &quot;X27&quot;,
			(case when (GOPGADMPRIV &amp; 268435456) &gt; 0 then 's' else '' end) AS &quot;X28&quot;
	FROM _V_GROUP_PRIV
	WHERE GOPGADMPRIV &gt; 0
	) as BLAH</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2050</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2050</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">When Global privileges are granted, a user or group can access all databases, including the system database. We recommend  that you avoid using GLOBAL grant where possible.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Objects privilges are granted without the GLOBAL option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Objects privilges have been granted with the GLOBAL option to one or more users or groups.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select (
	select count(*)
	from _V_USER_PRIV
	where UOPOBJPRIV &gt; 1
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	) + (
	select count(*)
	from _V_GROUP_PRIV
	where GOPOBJPRIV &gt; 1
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and GROUPNAME &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC'
	) as total_rows</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Object privileges granted with the GLOBAL option:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select USERNAME || ' (User) Database ' || DATABASENAME || '.' || OBJECTNAME || ': ' || X1 || X2 || X3 || X4 || X5 || X6 || X7 || X8 || X9 || X10 || X11 || X12 || X13 ||  X14 || X15 || X16 || X17
from (
	select	USERNAME as &quot;USERNAME&quot;,
			DATABASENAME as &quot;DATABASENAME&quot;,
			OBJECTNAME as &quot;OBJECTNAME&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X1&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'S' else '' end) AS &quot;X2&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'I' else '' end) AS &quot;X3&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'U' else '' end) AS &quot;X4&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'd' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'l' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'a' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;
	from _V_USER_PRIV
	where UOPOBJPRIV &gt; 1
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	) as BLAH
union
select GROUPNAME || ' (Group) Database '  || DATABASENAME || '.' || OBJECTNAME || ': ' || X1 || X2 || X3 || X4 || X5 || X6 || X7 || X8 || X9 || X10 || X11 || X12 || X13 ||  X14 || X15 || X16 || X17
from (
	select	GROUPNAME as &quot;GROUPNAME&quot;,
			DATABASENAME as &quot;DATABASENAME&quot;,
			OBJECTNAME as &quot;OBJECTNAME&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X1&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'S' else '' end) AS &quot;X2&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'I' else '' end) AS &quot;X3&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'U' else '' end) AS &quot;X4&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'd' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'l' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'a' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;
	from _V_GROUP_PRIV
	where GOPOBJPRIV &gt; 1
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and GROUPNAME &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC'
	) as BLAH</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you change authType to use &quot;md5&quot; or &quot;SHA_256&quot; in the /nz/data/pg_hba.conf for all entries that used &quot;password&quot;.  You will need to drop the connection ID that used &quot;password&quot; for authType, then add the same entry again using set connection with an encrypted authType.  Here is an example:  DROP CONNECTION 2;  SET CONNECTION HOST DATABASE 'all' IPADDR '192.168.123.456' IPMASK '255.255.255.255' AUTH 'md5';</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">AUTHTYPE is not set to &quot;password&quot;, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">AUTHTYPE is set to password for one or more connection types.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from _v_connection
where upper(connauth) = 'PASSWORD';</field>

Guardium provides an exception group named &quot;Netezza Allowed Grants to Public&quot;.  It contains some privileges that are granted to PUBLIC by default.  You can link this group to the test and add any additional members that may be required by your applications.</field>

    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'LIST_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'SELECT_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'INSERT_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'UPDATE_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'DELETE_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'TRUNCATE_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 'LOCK_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'ALTER_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'DROP_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'ABORT_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'LOAD_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'GENSTATS_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'EXECUTE_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'LABEL_ACCESS_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 131072) &gt; 0 then 'LABEL_RESTRICT_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 262144) &gt; 0 then 'LABEL_EXPAND_PRIVILEGE;' else '' end) ||
    (case when (GOPOBJPRIV &amp; 524288) &gt; 0 then 'EXECUTE_AS_PRIVILEG;' else '' end)
 FROM _V_SYS_GROUP_PRIV 
 WHERE GROUPNAME = 'PUBLIC' 
       AND GOPOBJPRIV &gt; 0
       AND OBJECTTYPE NOT IN ('SYSTEM VIEW', 'MANAGEMENT VIEW')</field>

			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'd' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'l' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (UOPOBJPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'a' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;
	from _V_USER_PRIV
	where UOPOBJPRIV &gt; 1
	) as BLAH</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2056</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2056</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">When Global privileges are granted, a user or group can access all databases, including the system database. We recommend that you avoid using GLOBAL grant where possible.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No admin privilges have been granted with the GLOBAL option.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more admin privileges has been granted with the GLOBAL option to users or groups. With global admin privileges, users can access all databases, including the system database.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select (
	SELECT count(*)
	FROM _V_USER_PRIV
	WHERE UOPADMPRIV &gt; 0
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and OBJECTNAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and OBJECTTYPE = 'GLOBAL'
	) + (
	SELECT count(*)
	FROM _V_GROUP_PRIV
	WHERE GOPADMPRIV &gt; 0
	and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and OBJECTNAME = 'GLOBAL'
	and OBJECTTYPE = 'GLOBAL'
	) as total_rows</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>

from (
	select	USERNAME as &quot;USERNAME&quot;,
			DATABASENAME as &quot;DATABASENAME&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;    1) &gt; 0 then 'D' else '' end) AS &quot;X1&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;    2) &gt; 0 then 'G' else '' end) AS &quot;X2&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;    4) &gt; 0 then 'U' else '' end) AS &quot;X3&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;    8) &gt; 0 then 'T' else '' end) AS &quot;X4&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;   16) &gt; 0 then 'V' else '' end) AS &quot;X5&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;   32) &gt; 0 then 'I' else '' end) AS &quot;X6&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;   64) &gt; 0 then 't' else '' end) AS &quot;X7&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;  128) &gt; 0 then 'P' else '' end) AS &quot;X8&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;  256) &gt; 0 then 'Q' else '' end) AS &quot;X9&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp;  512) &gt; 0 then 'F' else '' end) AS &quot;X10&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 1024) &gt; 0 then 'O' else '' end) AS &quot;X11&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 2048) &gt; 0 then 'r' else '' end) AS &quot;X12&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 4096) &gt; 0 then 'L' else '' end) AS &quot;X13&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 8192) &gt; 0 then 'M' else '' end) AS &quot;X14&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 16384) &gt; 0 then 'c' else '' end) AS &quot;X15&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 32768) &gt; 0 then 'e' else '' end) AS &quot;X16&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 65536) &gt; 0 then 'B' else '' end) AS &quot;X17&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 131072) &gt; 0 then 'R' else '' end) AS &quot;X18&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 262144) &gt; 0 then 'C' else '' end) AS &quot;X19&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 1048576) &gt; 0 then 'u' else '' end) AS &quot;X20&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 2097152) &gt; 0 then 'Y' else '' end) AS &quot;X21&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 4194304) &gt; 0 then 'S' else '' end) AS &quot;X22&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 8388608) &gt; 0 then 'H' else '' end) AS &quot;X23&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 16777216) &gt; 0 then 'E' else '' end) AS &quot;X24&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 33554432) &gt; 0 then 'X' else '' end) AS &quot;X25&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 67108864) &gt; 0 then 'A' else '' end) AS &quot;X26&quot;,
			(case when (UOPADMPRIV &amp; 134217728) &gt; 0 then 'N' else '' end) AS &quot;X27&quot;,

	where UOPADMPRIV &gt; 0
		  and DATABASENAME = 'GLOBAL'
		  and OBJECTNAME = 'GLOBAL'
		  and OBJECTTYPE = 'GLOBAL'

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2059</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2059</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke these grants, as they permit the grantee to pass along the grant to other roles and/or users.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No roles or users have been granted with the GRANT option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more roles and/or users have been granted to users or roles with the GRANT option.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from pg_auth_members m join pg_roles a on m.member = a.oid join pg_roles b on m.roleid = b.oid
where m.admin_option = 't'</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants made with the GRANT option:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Gratee=' || a.rolname  || ':Grantee_type=' ||
		case a.rolcanlogin
			when 'f' then 'role'
			when 't' then 'user'
		end || ':Role_or_User_Granted=' || 
		b.rolname 
from pg_auth_members m join pg_roles a on m.member = a.oid join pg_roles b on m.roleid = b.oid
where m.admin_option = 't'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2060</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2060</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend revoking superuser privilges from all roles and/or users immediately.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No users or roles have been granted superuser privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more users and/or roles have been granted superuser privileges.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from pg_roles
where rolsuper = 't'
and rolname &lt;&gt; 'postgres'</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Roles/users with superuser privileges:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select rolname || '(' ||
	case rolcanlogin
		when 'f' then 'Role'
		when 't' then 'User'
	end || ')'
from pg_roles
where rolsuper = 't'
and rolname &lt;&gt; 'postgres'
order by 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2061</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2061</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please verify these connections. DBA and Security admin should created their own admin account than using SA login.  This account must be protected and used under strict guideline.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">There are no finding of SA connection from multiple machines.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">There are finding of SA connection from multiple machines.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*) 
from master.dbo.sysprocesses 
where suid = suser_id('sa') 
and hostname &lt;&gt; '' 
and (select count(distinct hostname) 
from master.dbo.sysprocesses
where suid = suser_id('sa') 
and hostname &lt;&gt; '') &gt; 1</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">SA login from terminals:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select distinct hostname 
from master.dbo.sysprocesses 
where suid = suser_id('sa') 
and hostname &lt;&gt; '' 
and (select count(distinct hostname) 
from master.dbo.sysprocesses
where suid = suser_id('sa') 
and hostname &lt;&gt; '') &gt; 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please review the output and make necessary revoke privileges from users or roles that does not required access.  You can use this example command on master database to revoke: REVOKE ALL ON SYSLOGINS FROM GRANTEE.</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from master.dbo.sysprotects p, master.dbo.sysobjects o, master.dbo.sysusers u
where p.uid != 16385 
and u.uid = p.uid
and u.name &lt;&gt; 'gdmmonitor' 
and p.id=o.id 
and o.name='syslogins'
order by 1</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Grantee = ' + u.name + ' :  ' +  'Privilege = ' +
       case p.action
       	when 151 then 'REFERENCES' 
       	when 167 then 'SET PROXY OR SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION' 
       	when 193 then 'SELECT' 
       	when 195 then 'INSERT' 
       	when 196 then 'DELETE' 
       	when 197 then 'UPDATE' 
       	when 198 then 'CREATE TABLE' 
       	when 203 then 'CREATE DATABASE' 
       	when 205 then 'GRANT' 
       	when 206 then 'REVOKE' 
       	when 207 then 'CREATE VIEW' 
       	when 221 then 'CREATE TRIGGER' 
       	when 222 then 'CREATE PROCEDURE' 
       	when 224 then 'EXECUTE'
       	when 228 then 'DUMP DATABASE' 
       	when 233 then 'CREATE DEFAULT' 
       	when 235 then 'DUMP TRANSACTION' 
       	when 236 then 'CREATE RULE'
        when 282 then 'DELETE STATISTICS'
        when 320 then 'TRUNCATE TABLE'
        when 326 then 'UPDATE STATISTICS'
       end 
from master.dbo.sysprotects p, master.dbo.sysobjects o , master.dbo.sysusers u
where p.uid != 16385 
and u.uid = p.uid
and u.name &lt;&gt; 'gdmmonitor' 
and p.id=o.id 
and o.name='syslogins'
order by 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

       case p.action

       	when 167 then 'SET PROXY OR SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION' 
       	when 193 then 'SELECT' 
       	when 195 then 'INSERT' 
       	when 196 then 'DELETE' 
       	when 197 then 'UPDATE' 
       	when 198 then 'CREATE TABLE' 
       	when 203 then 'CREATE DATABASE' 
       	when 205 then 'GRANT' 
       	when 206 then 'REVOKE' 
       	when 207 then 'CREATE VIEW' 
       	when 221 then 'CREATE TRIGGER' 
       	when 222 then 'CREATE PROCEDURE' 
       	when 224 then 'EXECUTE'
       	when 228 then 'DUMP DATABASE' 
       	when 233 then 'CREATE DEFAULT' 
       	when 235 then 'DUMP TRANSACTION' 
       	when 236 then 'CREATE RULE' 
       end
from sybsystemprocs.dbo.sysprotects p, sybsystemprocs.dbo.sysobjects o , sybsystemprocs.dbo.sysusers u
where p.id = o.id 
      and p.uid = u.uid
      and o.name='sp_addauditrecord' 
      and u.name &lt;&gt; 'sso_role' 
order by 1</field>

	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2076</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2076</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend revoking any privilege and/or role grants to proxy accounts other than the CREATE SESSION privilege and the CONNECT role.  You can use the following command to revoke the privilege: REVOKE &lt;privilege&gt; FROM &lt;proxy_user&gt;.  A proxy user should only have the ability to connect to the database.  To exclude authorized privileged Authority users, you can create a group, populate it with authorized users and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No proxy accounts have been granted privileges/roles other than CREATE SESSION and/or CONNECT.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more proxy accounts has been granted a privilege or role other than CREATE SESSION and/or CONNECT.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select (
	select count(*)
	from	SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
			SYS.DBA_SYS_PRIVS priv 
	where	priv.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
	and		priv.PRIVILEGE &lt;&gt; 'CREATE SESSION'
	) + (
	select count(*)
	from	SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
			SYS.DBA_ROLE_PRIVS r 
	where	r.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
	and r.GRANTED_ROLE &lt;&gt; 'CONNECT'
	) + (
	select count(*)
	from	SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
		SYS.DBA_TAB_PRIVS t 
where	t.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
	) total_rows
from DUAL</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grants causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select distinct pu.PROXY || '@' || pu.CLIENT || ':  ' || priv.PRIVILEGE || ' (Privilege)'
from SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
		SYS.DBA_SYS_PRIVS priv 
where priv.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
		and priv.PRIVILEGE &lt;&gt; 'CREATE SESSION'
union all
select	distinct pu.PROXY || '@' || pu.CLIENT || ':  ' || r.GRANTED_ROLE || ' (Role)'
from	SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
		SYS.DBA_ROLE_PRIVS r 
where	r.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
and r.GRANTED_ROLE &lt;&gt; 'CONNECT'
union all
select	distinct pu.PROXY || '@' || pu.CLIENT || ':  ' || t.PRIVILEGE || ' (Privilege)'
from	SYS.PROXY_USERS pu,
		SYS.DBA_TAB_PRIVS t 
where	t.GRANTEE = pu.PROXY
order by 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">select  count(*)
from master.dbo.syssrvroles s, master.dbo.syslogins l, master.dbo.sysloginroles r 
where r.suid=l.suid 
and s.srid=r.srid 
and s.name in ('sa_role','sso_role','oper_role','sybase_ts_role','mon_role','replication_role')
and l.name &lt;&gt; 'sa'</field>

from master.dbo.syssrvroles s, master.dbo.syslogins l, master.dbo.sysloginroles r 
where r.suid=l.suid 
and s.srid=r.srid 
and s.name in ('sa_role','sso_role','oper_role','sybase_ts_role','mon_role','replication_role')
and l.name &lt;&gt; 'sa'
order by 1</field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2124</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2124</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The default port 5432 is widely known and is an easy target for attackers. We recommend that you use a different port.  PostgreSQL port setting is stored in postgresql.conf.  This change does require restart of the database server itself.  Becareful not to pick another port that is in use by your OS.    This is an important change, make sure all the admin users are aware of it.  Also each time you patch or upgrade your PostgreSQL server, verify to make sure that PostgreSQL does not change it back to the default. Make sure all the clients, application servers, tools, ODBC, JDBC are configure to use the new port number.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The default port is not used, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The default port 5432 is  being used.</field>
