	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2125</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2125</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We do not recommend granting duplicate privileges on resources. For best practice, duplicate privilege grants should be eliminated where possible, minimizing their use. If you need to exclude certain scenarios, you can create a group, then populate it with authorized objects detail, and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Duplicate grants was not found in system catalog for resources.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Duplicate grants was found in system catalog for resources.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM
(
SELECT GRANTEE,OBTYPE, QUALIFIER, NAME, COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSRESAUTH 
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
GROUP BY GRANTEE,OBTYPE, QUALIFIER, NAME
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
) AS MULTIPLE</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Obtype=' || OBTYPE || ': Qualifier=' ||
case
	when QUALIFIER is null then '  '
	when QUALIFIER = '' then '  '
    else ''
end 
||  QUALIFIER ||  ': Name=' || NAME || ': Privilege=Use: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3)) 
FROM SYSIBM.SYSRESAUTH 
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
GROUP BY GRANTEE,OBTYPE, QUALIFIER, NAME
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2126</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2126</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We do not recommend granting duplicate privileges on columns. For best practice, duplicate privilege grants should be eliminated where possible, minimizing their use. If you need to exclude certain scenarios, you can create a group, then populate it with authorized objects detail, and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Duplicate grants was not found in system catalog for columns.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Duplicate grants was found in system catalog for columns.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM
(
SELECT GRANTEE,CREATOR, TNAME, COLNAME, PRIVILEGE, COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSCOLAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,CREATOR, TNAME, COLNAME, PRIVILEGE
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
) AS MULTIPLE</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || CREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TNAME || ': Privilege=' || 
CASE PRIVILEGE
 WHEN 'R' THEN 'REFERENCES'
 WHEN '' THEN 'UPDATE'
 ELSE PRIVILEGE
END
||': Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSCOLAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,CREATOR, TNAME, COLNAME, PRIVILEGE
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1</field>

FROM SYSIBM.SYSPACKAUTH

AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND BINDAUTH IN ('Y','G')

HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1

SELECT GRANTEE,COLLID,NAME, 'COPYAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSPACKAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND COPYAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,COLLID,NAME

FROM SYSIBM.SYSPACKAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND EXECUTEAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,COLLID,NAME

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM
(
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'SELECTAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'				
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'				
AND SELECTAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'INSERTAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND INSERTAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'ALTERAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND ALTERAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'DELETEAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND DELETEAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'INDEXAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND INDEXAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'UPDATEAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND UPDATEAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'REFERENCESAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFERENCESAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME, 'TRIGGERAUTH', COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND TRIGGERAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
) AS MULTIPLE;</field>

AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND INSERTAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1

AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND ALTERAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || TCREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TTNAME || ': Privilege=DELETE: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH

AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND DELETEAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || TCREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TTNAME || ': Privilege=INDEX: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH

AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND INDEXAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || TCREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TTNAME || ': Privilege=UPDATE: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND UPDATEAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || TCREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TTNAME || ': Privilege=REFERENCE: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFERENCESAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 'Grantee=' || GRANTEE || ': Schema=' || TCREATOR || ': Object_name=' || TTNAME || ': Privilege=TRIGGER: Duplicate_count=' || CAST (COUNT(*) AS VARCHAR(3))
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND UPDATECOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND REFCOLS &lt;&gt; '*'
AND TRIGGERAUTH IN ('Y','G')
GROUP BY GRANTEE,TCREATOR, TTNAME 
HAVING COUNT(*) &gt; 1</field>

		<field name="TEST_ID">2133</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke CREATETABAUTH from unauthorize grantee.  You can use this command to revoke: REVOKE CREATETAB ON DATABASE &lt;database_name&gt; FROM &lt;grantee&gt;.  To exclude authorize create table grantee, you can create a group then populate it with authorize grantee and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Create table privilege has not been granted to unauthorize users.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Create table privilege has been granted to unauthorize users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)  
FROM SYSIBM.SYSDBAUTH  
WHERE CREATETABAUTH IN ('Y','G')  
AND GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM SYSIBM.SYSUSERAUTH WHERE (SYSADMAUTH IN ('Y','G') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('Y','G')))

AND DBCTRLAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G')
AND DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G')</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke STARTDBAUTH from unauthorize grantee.  You can use this command to revoke:  REVOKE STARTDB ON DATABASE &lt;database_name&gt; FROM &lt;grantee&gt;.  To exclude authorize STARTDB grantee, you can create  a group then populate it with authorize grantee and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">STARTDB privilege has not been granted to unauthorize users.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">STARTDB privilege has been granted to unauthorize users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)  
FROM SYSIBM.SYSDBAUTH  
WHERE STARTDBAUTH IN ('Y','G')  
AND GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM SYSIBM.SYSUSERAUTH WHERE (SYSADMAUTH IN ('Y','G') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('Y','G'))) 
AND DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G') 
AND DBCTRLAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G')
AND DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G')</field>

AND GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM SYSIBM.SYSUSERAUTH WHERE (SYSADMAUTH IN ('Y','G') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('Y','G'))) 
AND DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('Y','G')

AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND (ALTERAUTH = 'G' OR DELETEAUTH = 'G' OR INDEXAUTH = 'G' OR INSERTAUTH = 'G' OR SELECTAUTH = 'G' OR UPDATEAUTH = 'G' OR  REFERENCESAUTH = 'G' OR TRIGGERAUTH = 'G')  
AND GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM SYSIBM.SYSUSERAUTH WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('Y','G'))

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2184</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2184</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke database privileges from orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with database privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with database privileges was found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from SYSIBM.SYSDBAUTH AUTH
where AUTH.GRANTEETYPE = ''
and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR
and   AUTH.GRANTEE not in ('PUBLIC','PUBLIC*')
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_GROUP G WHERE G.GROUP = AUTH.GRANTEE)
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_USER U WHERE U.USER_ID = AUTH.GRANTEE);</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantees causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select DISTINCT 'GRANTEE = ' || AUTH.GRANTEE || ': DATABASE = ' || AUTH.NAME as AGRANT
from SYSIBM.SYSDBAUTH AUTH
where AUTH.GRANTEETYPE = ''
and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR
and   AUTH.GRANTEE not in ('PUBLIC','PUBLIC*')
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_GROUP G WHERE G.GROUP = AUTH.GRANTEE)
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_USER U WHERE U.USER_ID = AUTH.GRANTEE);</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2185</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2185</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke column privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with column privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with column privileges was found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSCOLAUTH AUTH
WHERE AUTH.GRANTEETYPE = ''
AND   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR
AND   AUTH.GRANTEE NOT IN ('PUBLIC','PUBLIC*')

AND GRANTEE NOT IN ('SYSADM','SYSIBM','SYSIBMTS','SYSPROC','SYSTOOLS','SYSFUN','SQLJ')

Users should be limited on DML and DDL privileges in reserved schema. 		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABAUTH 
WHERE GRANTOR &lt;&gt; GRANTEE
AND TCREATOR IN ('SYSADM','SYSIBM','SYSIBMTS','SYSPROC','SYSTOOLS','SYSFUN','SQLJ')

AND GRANTEE NOT IN ('SYSADM','SYSIBM','SYSIBMTS','SYSPROC','SYSTOOLS','SYSFUN','SQLJ')
AND GRANTEETYPE IN (' ','L')
AND NOT (TTNAME = 'SYSDUMMY1' AND TCREATOR = 'SYSIBM');</field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2194</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2194</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">You need to make sure all the logins do not have NULL password.  A secure database environment must not have logins with NULL password.  To change password in MSSQL 2005 and later do this.  ALTER LOGIN login_name WITH PASSWORD = 'securePassword';  To change password in MSSQL 2000, do this.  EXEC sp_password NULL, [securePassword], 'login_name'</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">You do not have logins with NULL password as recommend.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Logins with NULL password was found in your MSSQL server.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int,
        @priv_count int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
	set @priv_count = 0
	
	/* Check if user have enough privilege to run this test.  CONTROL SERVER and SYSADMIN is required for MSSQL2005 and beyond */
	/* If we don't check privilege, the query will still run, but it report INCORRECT result */
	/* If user does not have privlege to do this, then the test will force error */
	
    SELECT @priv_count = count(permission_name)    /* This query check your effective priv for Control server, sysadmin will also have control server granted too */
    FROM fn_my_permissions(NULL, 'SERVER')        /* It work even when you are a login part of security group */
    where permission_name = 'CONTROL SERVER'       /* which permission are only granted to group not per login */

	if @priv_count &gt; 0
	begin	
		SELECT count(*) FROM sys.sql_logins
		WHERE
		(PWDCOMPARE('', password_hash) = 1
		OR PWDCOMPARE('', password_hash, 1) = 1)
	end
	else	
	  BEGIN
	    RAISERROR('Error: You need SERVER CONTROL or SYSADMIN permission to run this test', 16, 1)
	  END
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	/* privilege validation is not required in MSSQL2000, it will error if privilege is insufficient*/
	SELECT count(*) FROM syslogins WHERE PWDCOMPARE ('', password) = 1 OR PWDCOMPARE('', password, 1) = 1 
end</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Logins with NULL password ==&gt;</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">declare
        @dbversion varchar(30),
        @dbnumber int,
        @priv_count int

SELECT @dbversion = CONVERT(varchar(20), SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion'))

if substring(@dbversion,2,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,1)
   end

if substring(@dbversion,3,1) = '.' 
   begin
	set @dbnumber = substring(@dbversion,1,2)
   end

if @dbnumber &gt;= 9
begin
	set @priv_count = 0
	
    SELECT @priv_count = count(permission_name)    /* This query check your effective priv for Control server, sysadmin will also have control server granted too */
    FROM fn_my_permissions(NULL, 'SERVER')        /* It work even when you are a login part of security group */
    where permission_name = 'CONTROL SERVER'       /* which permission are only granted to group not per login */

	if @priv_count &gt; 0
	begin	
		SELECT name FROM sys.sql_logins
		WHERE
		(PWDCOMPARE('', password_hash) = 1
		OR PWDCOMPARE('', password_hash, 1) = 1)
	end
	else	
		select 'You need SERVER CONTROL or SYSADMIN permission to run this test'
end

If @dbnumber &lt; 9
begin
	SELECT name FROM master.dbo.syslogins WHERE PWDCOMPARE ('', password) = 1 OR PWDCOMPARE('', password, 1) = 1 
end</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

	AND TABNAME = 'VARIABLEAUTH'
	AND GRANTEE = 'PUBLIC'

and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR

as AGRANT

and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME login policy option is not configured properly. Guardium recommends setting PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME to 7 or less.  The default threshold value for this test is 7, but it can be customized.  You can modify your PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME setting by running a command similar to this example: ALTER PROFILE &lt;profile_name&gt; LIMIT PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME 7;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME is set to an acceptable value</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME is not set, or is set to an unacceptable value</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select sum (COL1)
from (
	select count(*) COL1 from DBA_PROFILES
	where RESOURCE_NAME='PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME'
	and	PROFILE in  (
		select distinct PROFILE
		from DBA_USERS where
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	and	(LIMIT is null or LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')
	union
	select count(*) COL1 from DBA_PROFILES
	where RESOURCE_NAME='PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME'
	and	PROFILE in  (select distinct PROFILE
		from DBA_USERS where
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	and	(
		LIMIT is not null and
		LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' and
		LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' and
		length(trim(translate(LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) is null and
		lpad(LIMIT,40,'0') &gt; lpad(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
		)
	) MYCOUNT</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Profiles causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Profile = ' ||PROFILE || ' : Limit = ' || LIMIT from DBA_PROFILES
where RESOURCE_NAME='PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME'
and	PROFILE in  (
	select distinct PROFILE
	from DBA_USERS where
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
and	(LIMIT is null or LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')
union
select 'Profile = ' ||PROFILE || ' : Limit = ' || LIMIT from DBA_PROFILES
where RESOURCE_NAME='PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME'
and	PROFILE in  (select distinct PROFILE
	from DBA_USERS where
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
and	(
	LIMIT is not null and
	LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' and
	LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' and
	length(trim(translate(LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) is null and
	lpad(LIMIT,40,'0') &gt; lpad(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
	)</field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2204</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2204</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">SEC_RETURN_SERVER_RELEASE_BANNER controls whether Oracle returns complete database software information to clients.  When set to TRUE, Oracle
responds to client login attempts with iformation that could be valuable to attackers.  We recommend that you set SEC_RETURN_SERVER_RELEASE_BANNER to FALSE.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">SEC_RETURN_SERVER_RELEASE_BANNER is set to FALSE, as recommended</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">SEC_RETURN_SERVER_RELEASE_BANNER is set to TRUE, which is a vulnerability.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare

	nver	number;
	retval	integer := 0;
	sver	varchar2(255) := '';
	strval	varchar2(255) := '';

begin

	select VERSION
	into sver
	from V$INSTANCE;

	nver := to_number(substr(sver,1,(instr(sver,'.',1,2) - 1)));

	if nver &gt;= 11.1 then

		select VALUE
		into strval
		from V$PARAMETER
		where NAME = 'sec_return_server_release_banner';

	end if;

	if (nver &lt; 11.1 or strval = 'FALSE') then
		retval := 0;
	else
		retval := 1;
	end if;

	? := retval;

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2205</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2205</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke routine privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with routine privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with routine privileges was found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select COUNT(DISTINCT AUTH.GRANTEE || AUTH.SCHEMA || AUTH.SPECIFICNAME)
from SYSIBM.SYSROUTINEAUTH AUTH
where AUTH.GRANTEETYPE = ''
and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR
and   AUTH.GRANTEE not in ('PUBLIC','PUBLIC*')
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_GROUP G WHERE G.GROUP = AUTH.GRANTEE)
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_USER U WHERE U.USER_ID = AUTH.GRANTEE);</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantees causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select DISTINCT 'Grantee = ' || AUTH.GRANTEE || ': Schema = ' || AUTH.SCHEMA || ': Object_name = ' || AUTH.SPECIFICNAME
from SYSIBM.SYSROUTINEAUTH AUTH
where AUTH.GRANTEETYPE = ''
and   AUTH.GRANTEE &lt;&gt; AUTH.GRANTOR
and   AUTH.GRANTEE not in ('PUBLIC','PUBLIC*')
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_GROUP G WHERE G.GROUP = AUTH.GRANTEE)
AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_USER U WHERE U.USER_ID = AUTH.GRANTEE);</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">One or more of these system dbspaces (IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN, system, IQ_SYSTEM_TEMP, IQ_SYSTEM_MSG) has been configured to users or group's default_dbspace.  To remediate this issue, you should create a second main dbspace and set the default to your custom dbspaces.  Example syntax:  SET OPTION PUBLIC.default_dbspace = 'user_main'.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The DEFAULT_DBSPACE option is configured as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The DEFAULT_DBSPACE option is set to one of your system dbspaces.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN
DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  then
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' then
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT COUNT(*) 
   FROM SYS.SYSOPTIONS 
   WHERE &quot;option&quot; = 'default_dbspace' AND setting in ('IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN', 'system', 'IQ_SYSTEM_TEMP', 'IQ_SYSTEM_MSG');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">DEFAULT_DBSPACE current setting:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN
DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  then
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' then
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
    SELECT 'Grantee = ' || user_name || ' : default_dbspace = ' || setting  
    FROM SYS.SYSOPTIONS 
    WHERE &quot;option&quot; = 'default_dbspace' AND setting in ('IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN', 'system', 'IQ_SYSTEM_TEMP', 'IQ_SYSTEM_MSG');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The DBA user is present in your database, and its password has not been set to NULL.  We recommend setting your DBA password to NULL so that login using this account is not possible.  Make sure you have at least one other user with DBA privileges defined before setting the DBA account password to NULL.  Example syntax:  ALTER USER DBA IDENTIFIED BY NULL</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">DBA account password is set to NULL, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">DBA account password is not set to NULL.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT COUNT(*) FROM SYS.SYSUSER WHERE password IS NOT NULL AND UPPER(user_name) = 'DBA';
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">One or more sample schema have been found.  We recommend that you remove all sample schemas shipped with the database installation.  You may have to drop all the objects owned by the sample schema before dropping the actual schema.   Example syntax:  DROP USER GROUPRW</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The sample schemas are not present in your database.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more sample schemas are present in your database (i.e., have not been removed).</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT COUNT(*) 
   FROM SYS.SYSUSER u
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a ON u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE u.user_name IN ('GROUPR', 'GROUPRW', 'GROUPO');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Default schema found:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT RTRIM(u.user_name) 
   FROM SYS.SYSUSER u
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a ON u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE u.user_name IN ('GROUPR', 'GROUPRW', 'GROUPO');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2217</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2217</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you revoke table and view privileges granted with the grant option. We recommend that you restructure your object privilege grants so that they do not include the grant option. If you need to exclude certain grantees or object privileges that require the grant option in your environment, you can create an exception group and populate it with the names of authorized grantees and/or objects, and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Object privileges are not being granted with the grant option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more object privileges have been granted with the grant option.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
      SELECT COUNT(*)
      FROM SYS.SYSTABAUTH ta 
      	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON ta.grantee = u.user_name
      	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSTAB t ON USER_NAME(t.creator) = ta.tcreator AND t.table_name = ta.ttname
      	LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON u.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
      WHERE ta.grantor &lt;&gt; 'SYS'
   AND (ta.selectauth = 'G' OR ta.insertauth = 'G' OR ta.deleteauth = 'G' OR ta.updateauth = 'G' OR ta.updatecols = 'G' OR ta.alterauth = 'G' OR ta.referenceauth = 'G');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Tables or views with grant option privileges found:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT 'Grantee_type=' ||
              CASE
                  WHEN g.auth IS NULL THEN 'User'
                  ELSE 'Group'
              END ||
           ' : Grantee=' ||
           ta.grantee ||
           ' : Type=' ||
           t.table_type_str  ||
           ' : Object=' ||
           ta.tcreator ||
           '.' ||
           ta.ttname 
   FROM SYS.SYSTABAUTH ta 
   	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON ta.grantee = u.user_name
   	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSTAB t ON USER_NAME(t.creator) = ta.tcreator AND t.table_name = ta.ttname
   	LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON u.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE ta.grantor &lt;&gt; 'SYS'
   AND (ta.selectauth = 'G' OR ta.insertauth = 'G' OR ta.deleteauth = 'G' OR ta.updateauth = 'G' OR ta.updatecols = 'G' OR ta.alterauth = 'G' OR ta.referenceauth = 'G')
   ORDER BY g.auth, ta.grantee, t.table_type_str;  
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.2 THEN
	SELECT  COUNT(*)
    FROM dbo.guardium_sa_get_user_status() g
    JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON g.user_id = u.user_id
    WHERE g.locked  = 1
    AND u.password IS NOT NULL;
ELSE
    RAISERROR 99999 'This specific test is not supported this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15.2 or higher to use this test';
END IF;

END;</field>

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.2 THEN
    SELECT 'Account=' || g.user_name || ' : Reason_locked=' || g.reason_locked 
    FROM dbo.guardium_sa_get_user_status() g
    JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON g.user_id = u.user_id
    WHERE g.locked  = 1
    AND u.password IS NOT NULL;
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15.2 or higher to use this test';
END IF;

You can modify your MAX_CONNECTIONS setting by running via this sample command: ALTER LOGIN POLICY ROOT MAX_CONNECTIONS = 8;</field>

		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The MAX_CONNECTIONS option is not set.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT  COUNT(DISTINCT login_policy_name)
	FROM SYS.SYSUSER AS u
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICY AS lp
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICYOPTION AS lpo
	WHERE login_option_name = 'max_connections'
	      AND (ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 0 
		   OR ( ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 1) 
		   AND CAST(login_option_value AS INT) = 0
		  );
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

  SELECT 1;

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN login policy option is not configured properly. Guardium recommends setting this value to 'ON'.  You can modify PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN by running this command:  ALTER LOGIN POLICY ROOT PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN = ON;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN option is configured as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN option is not set to ON.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT  COUNT(DISTINCT login_policy_name)
	FROM SYS.SYSUSER AS u
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICY AS lp
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICYOPTION AS lpo
	WHERE login_option_name = 'password_expiry_on_next_login'
	      AND UPPER(login_option_value) &lt;&gt; 'ON';
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">PASSWORD_EXPIRY_ON_NEXT_LOGIN current setting:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT  DISTINCT 'Login Policy name=' || login_policy_name || 
			 ' : ' || login_option_name || '=' || login_option_value
	FROM SYS.SYSUSER AS u
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICY AS lp
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICYOPTION AS lpo
	WHERE login_option_name = 'password_expiry_on_next_login'
	      AND UPPER(login_option_value) &lt;&gt; 'ON';
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2225</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2225</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME login policy option is not configured.  Guardium recommends setting PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME to 14 days.  You can modify your database option by a command similar to this example:  ALTER LOGIN POLICY ROOT PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME = 14;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME option is configured, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The PASSWORD_GRACE_TIME option is not set.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT  COUNT(DISTINCT login_policy_name)
	FROM SYS.SYSUSER AS u
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICY AS lp
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICYOPTION AS lpo
	WHERE login_option_name = 'password_grace_time'
	      AND (ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 0 
		   OR ( ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 1) 
		   AND CAST(login_option_value AS INT) = 0
		  );
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT  COUNT(DISTINCT login_policy_name)
	FROM SYS.SYSUSER AS u
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICY AS lp
	     KEY JOIN SYS.SYSLOGINPOLICYOPTION AS lpo
	WHERE login_option_name = 'password_life_time'	
          AND (
              (ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 0 )
		   OR (ISNUMERIC(login_option_value) = 1 AND (CAST(login_option_value AS INT) &gt; %THRESHOLD% OR CAST(login_option_value AS INT) = 0))
              );
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you grant object privileges to groups instead of to individual users.  You can remove individual grants via a command similar to this example: REVOKE EXECUTE ON procedure_name FROM USER.  A predefined group name &quot;Sybase IQ No individual procedures or functions privileges&quot; is shipped with this test to exclude default grants from Sybase IQ.  You can use this exception group or clone it to add additional authorized grantees then link our group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Stored procedure and function privileges are not granted directly to individual users, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more stored procedure and/or function privileges have been granted directly to individual users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
	SELECT COUNT(*)
	FROM SYS.SYSPROCAUTH pa 
	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON pa.grantee = u.user_name
	INNER JOIN SYS.SYSPROCEDURE p ON USER_NAME(p.creator) = pa.creator AND p.proc_name = pa.procname
	WHERE NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT 'X'
		  FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
		  WHERE u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Users with direct stored procedures or functions privileges:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
    SELECT  'Grantee=' ||
        pa.grantee || 
        ' : Object=' ||
        pa.creator ||
        '.' ||
         pa.procname ||
        ' : Object_type=' ||
        CASE
            WHEN  M.parm_id is NULL THEN 'Procedure'
            ELSE 'Function'
        END
    FROM SYS.SYSPROCAUTH pa 
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON pa.grantee = u.user_name
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSPROCEDURE p ON USER_NAME(p.creator) = pa.creator AND p.proc_name = pa.procname
    LEFT OUTER JOIN SYS.SYSPROCPARM M ON M.proc_id = p.proc_id AND M.parm_type = 4
    WHERE NOT EXISTS
        (SELECT 'X'
          FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
          WHERE u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP')
    ORDER BY pa.grantee, pa.creator, pa.procname;
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2229</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2229</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you grant object privileges to group instead to individual users.  If you must exclude certain grantees or objects from this policy, you can create an exception group and populate it with authorized grantees and/or objects, and then link your group to this test.  You can remove individual grants via a command similar to this example: REVOKE ALL ON SCHEMA.OBJECT_NAME FROM USER.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Table and view privileges are not granted directly to individual users, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more table or view privileges have been granted directly to users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT COUNT(*) FROM SYS.SYSTABAUTH ta 
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON ta.grantee = u.user_name
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSTAB t ON USER_NAME(t.creator) = ta.tcreator AND t.table_name = ta.ttname
   WHERE NOT EXISTS
   	(SELECT 'X'
             FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
             WHERE u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP')
   AND ta.grantor &lt;&gt; 'SYS';
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Users with direct tables or views privileges:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
SELECT  'Type=' ||
        t.table_type_str  ||
        ' : Grantee=' ||
        ta.grantee ||
        ' : Object=' ||
        ta.tcreator ||
        '.' ||
         ta.ttname 
FROM SYS.SYSTABAUTH ta 
INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON ta.grantee = u.user_name
INNER JOIN SYS.SYSTAB t ON USER_NAME(t.creator) = ta.tcreator AND t.table_name = ta.ttname
WHERE NOT EXISTS
	(SELECT 'X'
          FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
          WHERE u.user_id = a.user_id AND a.auth = 'GROUP')
AND ta.grantor &lt;&gt; 'SYS';
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

Individual users can then acquire these privileges by virtue of membership in an appropriate user group. A predefined group name &quot;Sybase IQ Procedures and functions granted to PUBLIC&quot; is shipped with this test to exclude default grants from Sybase IQ. 		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2232</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2232</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you revoke BACKUP authority from unauthorized grantees.  You can use this example command to revoke this authority: REVOKE BACKUP FROM UNAUTHORIZE_GRANTEE.  To exclude authorized grantees from this test,you can populate an exception group with your authorized grantees and link the group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">BACKUP authority has not been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">BACKUP authority has been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  COUNT(*)
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'BACKUP'
   AND u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY where auth = 'DBA');   
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee with BACKUP authority:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  'Grantee=' || 
       	   u.user_name || 
           ' : Grantee_type=' ||
           CASE
               WHEN g.auth IS NULL THEN 'User'
               ELSE 'Group'
           END
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'BACKUP'
   AND u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY where auth = 'DBA');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2233</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2233</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you revoke DBA authority from unauthorized grantees.  Make sure you have at least one DBA account and verify the login actually work before revoking any DBA grants, to prevent locking yourself out from the system.  You can use this example command to revoke this authority: REVOKE DBA FROM UNAUTHORIZE_GRANTEE.  To exclude authorized grantees from this test, you can populate an exception group with your authorized grantees and link the group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">DBA authority has not been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">DBA authority has been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  COUNT(*)
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'DBA'
   AND u.user_name NOT IN ('SYS','DBA','dbo');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee with DBA authority:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  'Grantee=' || 
       	   u.user_name || 
           ' : Grantee_type=' ||
           CASE
               WHEN g.auth IS NULL THEN 'User'
               ELSE 'Group'
           END
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'DBA'
   AND u.user_name NOT IN ('SYS','DBA','dbo');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee with REMOTE DBA authority:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  'Grantee=' || 
       	   u.user_name || 
           ' : Grantee_type=' ||
           CASE
               WHEN g.auth IS NULL THEN 'User'
               ELSE 'Group'
           END
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'REMOTE DBA'
   AND u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY where auth = 'DBA');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

You can use this example command to revoke this authority: REVOKE RESOURCE FROM UNAUTHORIZE_GRANTEE.  To exclude authorized grantees from this test,you can populate an exception group with your authorized grantees and link the group to this test.roup to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">RESOURCE authority has not been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">RESOURCE authority has been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  COUNT(*)
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'RESOURCE'
   AND u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY where auth = 'DBA');   
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee with RESOURCE authority:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
   SELECT  'Grantee=' || 
       	   u.user_name || 
           ' : Grantee_type=' ||
           CASE
               WHEN g.auth IS NULL THEN 'User'
               ELSE 'Group'
           END
   FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY a
   INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER u ON u.user_id = a.user_id
   LEFT JOIN SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY g ON a.user_id = g.user_id AND g.auth = 'GROUP'
   WHERE UPPER(a.auth) = 'RESOURCE'
   AND u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM SYS.SYSUSERAUTHORITY where auth = 'DBA');   
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">PUBLIC has the CREATE privilege on one or more system dbspaces (IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN and SYSTEM). To remediate this issue, revoke the CREATE privilege on these dbpsaces from PUBLIC.  Example syntax:  REVOKE CREATE ON IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN FROM PUBLIC.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">PUBLIC does not have the CREATE privilege on system dbspaces.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">PUBLIC has the CREATE privilege on one or more system dbspaces.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
    SELECT COUNT(*)
    FROM SYS.SYSDBSPACEPERM P 
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSDBSPACE S ON P.dbspace_id = S.dbspace_id
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER U ON P.grantee = U.user_id
    WHERE U.user_name = 'PUBLIC'
    AND S.dbspace_name in ('IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN', 'system');
ELSE
  SELECT 1;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Dbspaces granted to PUBLIC:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
    SELECT 'Grantee = ' || U.user_name || ' : Dbspace_name = ' || S.dbspace_name
    FROM SYS.SYSDBSPACEPERM P 
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSDBSPACE S ON P.dbspace_id = S.dbspace_id
    INNER JOIN SYS.SYSUSER U ON P.grantee = U.user_id
    WHERE U.user_name = 'PUBLIC'
    AND S.dbspace_name in ('IQ_SYSTEM_MAIN', 'system');
ELSE
  SELECT 'Guardium does not support this Sybase IQ release, Please upgrade to Sybase IQ 15 or higher to use Guardium VA test';
END IF;

END;</field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2248</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2248</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">A robust password verification function enforces strong password policies across your database.  We strongly recommend that you implement a password verification function as a first step towards securing your database.  For more information, you can visit the Sybase infocenter or review Sybase reference statement and options PDF.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The VERIFY_PASSWORD_FUNCTION option is configured, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The VERIFY_PASSWORD_FUNCTION option is not configured for PUBLIC.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">BEGIN

DECLARE  dbversion VARCHAR(255);
DECLARE  dbnumber DECIMAL;

SELECT @@VERSION INTO dbversion;

IF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,10) = 'Sybase IQ/'  THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,11,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSEIF SUBSTRING(dbversion,1,19) = 'Adaptive Server IQ/' THEN
    SELECT SUBSTRING(dbversion,20,4) INTO dbnumber;
ELSE
    SELECT 0 INTO dbnumber;
END IF;

IF dbnumber &gt;= 15.0 THEN
    SELECT COUNT(*)
    FROM SYS.SYSPROCS P JOIN SYS.SYSOPTIONS o ON LEFT(o.setting, CHARINDEX('.', o.setting ) - 1) = p.creator AND RIGHT(o.setting, BYTE_LENGTH(o.setting) -  CHARINDEX('.', o.setting )) = p.procname
    WHERE &quot;option&quot; = 'verify_password_function' AND user_name = 'PUBLIC' ;
ELSE
  SELECT 0;
END IF;

END;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">6</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2249</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2249</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">AUTORESTART is set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">AUTORESTART parameter is not set as recommended. It is recommended that AUTORESTART be set ON.  Example syntax: db2 connect to &lt;db_name&gt;; db2 update database configuration using autorestart on;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">AUTORESTART=ON</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">AUTORESTART=OFF(Expected: ON)</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM SYSIBMADM.DBCFG
WHERE LOWER(NAME) = 'autorestart' AND LOWER(VALUE) = 'on'</field>

We recommend setting this parameter to 3 or higher to ensure that all errors and warnings are written to the log. However, the DIAG_LEVEL parameter should be set to a minimum value of 3.  Example syntax:  db2 update dbm cfg using DIAGLEVEL 3;</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">DISCOVER is set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Discovery Mode is Enabled. Setting this value to ENABLE allows the client to send broadcast requests on the network for response by any available DB2 servers on the server that are configured to respond. A response to a discovery request contains information on all instances and databases on the server. This could lead to unauthorized access attempts to a remote instance or database. While less convenient, clients and other servers should be required to have connection information manually defined for them or use LDAP for retrieving database catalog information. We recommend to disable the Discovery mode.  Example syntax:  db2 update dbm cfg using DISCOVER disable;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">DISCOVER is set to DISABLE.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">DISCOVER is not set to DISABLE.</field>

		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2266</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2266</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">Remote logins are mapped to unique local login IDs, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Multiple remote logins are mapped to one local login ID, implying that multiple remote users are using the same local login ID.  We recommend that you map each remote login to a unique local login to maintain identifiability and accountability.  You can execute sp_helpremotelogin command to see a list of remote login user defined in your system.  This information is also provided in the detail section.  To remediate the issue, you can use sp_dropremotelogin and sp_addremotelogin to recreate remote login associated with unique local logins.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No non-unique remote users found.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Non-unique remote users found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from 
(
select srv.srvname &quot;Server_name&quot;, log.name &quot;Local_mapped_user&quot;,  count(*) as
&quot;Count_remote_login_mapped&quot;
from
      master.dbo.sysservers srv,
      master.dbo.syslogins log,
      master.dbo.sysremotelogins rmt
where log.suid = rmt.suid and srv.srvid = rmt.remoteserverid
group by srv.srvname, log.name
having count(*) &gt; 1
) as non_unique_mapped_login</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Remote Servers with non-unique local login.</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Server_name = '  + srv.srvname +
       ' : Local_mapped_user = ' + log.name +
       ' : Number_of_remote_login_mapped = ' + cast(count(*) as varchar(50)) 
from
      master.dbo.sysservers srv,
      master.dbo.syslogins log,
      master.dbo.sysremotelogins rmt
where log.suid = rmt.suid and srv.srvid = rmt.remoteserverid
group by srv.srvname, log.name
having count(*) &gt; 1</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>

		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Login = ' + name + ' : Status = ' + 
case status
when 2 then 'Locked'
when 4 then 'Expired'
when 482 then 'Locked'
else cast(status as varchar(10))
end
from master.dbo.syslogins 
where (status&amp;2 = 2   /*Login locked*/
or status&amp;4 = 4)      /*passoword has expired*/
and name in (~~G~Critical Accounts - Sybase ASE~~)</field>

AND u.password IS NOT NULL
AND g.user_name in (~~G~Critical Accounts - Sybase IQ~~);</field>

WHERE g.locked  = 1
AND u.password IS NOT NULL

		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select'Grantee = ' || trim(username)  || ' : Authority = ' ||
    case usertype
    when 'D' then 'DBA'
    when 'R' then 'Resource'
    when 'C' then 'Connect'
    when 'G' then 'Role'
    when 'U' then 'Default role'
    else 'unknown'
   end 
from informix.sysusers
where lower(username) = 'public';</field>

		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Stored procedure and function privileges are not granted directly to individual users, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more stored procedure and/or function have been granted directly to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from informix.sysprocedures p, informix.sysprocauth a

and lower(a.grantee) not in ('public','informix');</field>

       	 substr(a.tabauth, 7,1) = 'A' or

         substr(a.tabauth, 9,1) = 'N');</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend granting server level permissions to administrators or authorized grantees only. Please review the list of permissions found from this test.  You can remove individual grants via a command similar to this example: REVOKE &lt;Permission Name&gt; ON LOGIN :: &lt;userID&gt; FROM &lt;user ID&gt;; Please refer to the SQL Server online documentation for various REVOKE options that relate to your specific environment.  Guardium provide an exception group (MS-SQL Access to server level permissions granted to non-Database Administrators) that contains some default system grantees that should be exclude.  In addition, the Guardium VA scan account also require certain server level privileges that you should add to this exception group as well.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Access to server level permissions are granted to authorized grantees only.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Access to server level permissions has been granted to unauthorized grantees.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM  sys.server_permissions AS p JOIN sys.server_principals AS l 
ON   p.grantee_principal_id = l.principal_id
Where p.grantee_principal_id NOT IN (Select member_principal_id from sys.server_role_members where role_principal_id = 3)
and p.class_desc = 'SERVER'
and (p.state = 'G' OR p.state = 'W')
and p.permission_name NOT in ('CONNECT SQL')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Permissions granted to non-Database Administrators:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'User ID = ' + l.name collate database_default + ', Permission = ' + p.permission_name collate database_default 
FROM  sys.server_permissions AS p JOIN sys.server_principals AS l 
ON   p.grantee_principal_id = l.principal_id
Where p.grantee_principal_id NOT IN (Select member_principal_id from sys.server_role_members where role_principal_id = 3)
and p.class_desc = 'SERVER'
and (p.state = 'G' OR p.state = 'W')
and p.permission_name NOT in ('CONNECT SQL')</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM msdb.sys.database_role_members rm 
JOIN msdb.sys.database_principals p ON rm.role_principal_id = p.principal_id 
JOIN msdb.sys.database_principals m ON rm.member_principal_id = m.principal_id
WHERE p.name in ('db_dtsadmin','db_dtsoperator','db_dtsltduser','db_ssisadmin','db_ssisltduser','db_ssisoperator')
and m.name != 'dbo'
and m.sid NOT IN (	select m.sid
FROM msdb.sys.server_role_members rm 
JOIN msdb.sys.server_principals p ON rm.role_principal_id = p.principal_id 
JOIN msdb.sys.server_principals m ON rm.member_principal_id = m.principal_id
where rm.role_principal_id IN (3, 4))</field>

FROM msdb.sys.database_role_members rm 
JOIN msdb.sys.database_principals p ON rm.role_principal_id = p.principal_id 
JOIN msdb.sys.database_principals m ON rm.member_principal_id = m.principal_id
WHERE p.name in ('db_dtsadmin','db_dtsoperator','db_dtsltduser','db_ssisadmin','db_ssisltduser','db_ssisoperator')
and m.name != 'dbo'
and m.sid NOT IN (	select m.sid
FROM msdb.sys.server_role_members rm 
JOIN msdb.sys.server_principals p ON rm.role_principal_id = p.principal_id 
JOIN msdb.sys.server_principals m ON rm.member_principal_id = m.principal_id

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that the Named Piped protocol to be disabled when it is not document as a requirement.
To disable named pipes protocol for  MSSQLSERVER, perform the following steps: 
1. Open Computer Manager using the following Run command: compmgmt.msc. 
2. Expand Services and Applications. 
3. Expand SQL Server Configuration Manager. 
4. Expand SQL Server Network Configuration and click on Protocols for SQL Server; 
5. Double click on the Named Pipes Protocol to Disable it if it is enabled.</field>

		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Named Pipes protocol is enabled.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @Np     int


select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
BEGIN
  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
  @value=@SQLPath output
END

if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
BEGIN
 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
 @value=@SQLPath output
END

/* Set registry path */
set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib\Np' 

EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
@key=@reg_key, @value_name='Enabled',
@value=@Np output	

select @Np</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @Np     int


select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
BEGIN
  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
  @value=@SQLPath output
END

if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
BEGIN
 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
 @value=@SQLPath output
END

/* Set registry path */
set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib\Np' 

EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
@key=@reg_key, @value_name='Enabled',
@value=@Np output	

If @Np = 0
	BEGIN
	SELECT 'Named Pipes protocol is disabled'
	END
ELSE
	SELECT 'Named Pipes protocol is enabled'</field>
