		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">To maintain a higher level protection for database instances, we recommend that SQL Server Instance be hidden when it is not required. Please note that this test does not include Clustered Instances as turning off this feature may cause issues with the Clustered environment. To set the hide SQL Server Instance option, perform the following steps: 
1. Open Computer Manager using the following Run command: compmgmt.msc. 
2. Expand Services and Applications. 
3. Expand SQL Server Configuration Manager. 
4. Expand SQL Server Network Configuration and right click Protocols for SQL Server; select Properties. 
5. The Hide Instance option may be set on the Flags tab.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">SQL Server Instance is not advertised by the SQL Server Browser service.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">SQL Server Instance is advertised by the SQL Server Browser service.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">DECLARE @priv_count int
DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @HideInstance     int


set @priv_count = 0

/* Check if user have enough privilege to run this test.  SYSADMIN server role is required for using xp_regread */
/* If user does not have privlege to do this, then the test will force error */


SELECT 	@priv_count = is_srvrolemember('sysadmin')		/* This query check if the user have sysadmin right*/

IF @priv_count &gt; 0
BEGIN	

	select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

	if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
	BEGIN
	  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

	  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
	  @value=@SQLPath output
	END

	if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
	BEGIN
	 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

	 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
	 @value=@SQLPath output
	END

	/* Set registry path */
	set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib' 

	EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	@key=@reg_key, @value_name='HideInstance',
	@value=@HideInstance output	

	select @HideInstance 

END
else	
      BEGIN
         RAISERROR('Error: This test require sysadmin server role, you should create another datasource with sysadmin privilege to execute this test', 16, 1)
      END</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">1</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">DECLARE @priv_count int
DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @HideInstance     int

set @priv_count = 0

/* Check if user have enough privilege to run this test.  SYSADMIN server role is required for using xp_regread */
/* If user does not have privlege to do this, then the test will force error */

SELECT 	@priv_count = is_srvrolemember('sysadmin')		/* This query check if the user have sysadmin right*/

IF @priv_count &gt; 0
BEGIN	

	select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

	if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
	BEGIN
	  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

	  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
	  @value=@SQLPath output
	END

	if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
	BEGIN
	 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

	 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
	 @value=@SQLPath output
	END

	/* Set registry path */
	set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib' 

	EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
	@key=@reg_key, @value_name='HideInstance',
	@value=@HideInstance output	

	If @HideInstance = 0
		BEGIN
		SELECT 'SQL Server Instance is not hidden'
		END
	ELSE
		SELECT 'SQL Server Instance is hidden'

END
else	
      BEGIN
         RAISERROR('Error: This test require sysadmin server role, you should create another datasource with sysadmin privilege to execute this test', 16, 1)
      END</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">DECLARE @cluster     int
DECLARE @pass     int

select @cluster = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('IsClustered')AS sysname)

if @cluster &gt; 0
BEGIN
	set @pass = 0		/* 0 means pass, 1 means fail */
END
ELSE
BEGIN
	 set @pass = 1
END
select @pass</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE">This test does not apply to Clustered Instances.</field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2302</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2302</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you to increase the SQL server logs to 20 or more.  The default threshold value for this test is 20, but the threshold can be customized to meet your organization's needs. Please perform the following steps to adjust SQL Server Error Log retention:  1). Open SQL Server Management Studio. 2). Open Object Explorer and connect to the target instance. 3). Navigate to the Management tab in Object Explorer and expand. Right click on the SQL Server Logs file and select Configure. The number of SQL Error logs may be configured from this menu.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">SQL Server logs is configured as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">SQL Server logs is set to an unacceptable value.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @NumErrorLogs     int
DECLARE @pass	  int



select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
BEGIN
  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
  @value=@SQLPath output
END

if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
BEGIN
 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
 @value=@SQLPath output
END

/* Set registry path */
set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer' 

EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
@key=@reg_key, @value_name='NumErrorLogs',
@value=@NumErrorLogs output	

if @NumErrorLogs &gt;= %THRESHOLD%
BEGIN
	set @pass = 0		/* 0 means pass, 1 means fail */
END
ELSE
BEGIN
	 set @pass = 1
END
select @pass</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">DECLARE @SQLPath varchar(500)
DECLARE @instance_name varchar(20)
DECLARE @reg_key varchar(500)
DECLARE @NumErrorLogs     int


select  @instance_name = CAST(SERVERPROPERTY('instancename')AS sysname)

if @instance_name is NOT NULL		/*Mean name instance */
BEGIN
  set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

  EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
  @key=@reg_key, @value_name=@instance_name,
  @value=@SQLPath output
END

if @instance_name is NULL          /*Mean default instance MSSQLSERVER */
BEGIN
 set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\Instance Names\Sql'

 EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
 @key=@reg_key, @value_name='MSSQLSERVER',
 @value=@SQLPath output
END

/* Set registry path */
set @reg_key = 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\' + @SQLPath + '\MSSQLServer' 

EXEC master..xp_regread @rootkey='HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE', 
@key=@reg_key, @value_name='NumErrorLogs',
@value=@NumErrorLogs output	

if @NumErrorLogs is NULL      
BEGIN
	set @NumErrorLogs = 6             /* default NumErrorLogs is 6 */
END


SELECT 'SQL Server logs is set to ' + CAST(@NumErrorLogs as varchar(3))</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX parameter is not configured properly. Guardium recommends setting this to 20 or higher; however, this value may be customized to meet your organization's needs by changing the test default threshold.  You can alter your database profile by running the example command: ALTER PROFILE &lt;PROFILE_NAME&gt; LIMIT PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX 20;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX is configured, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX is not set, or is set to an unacceptable value.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT SUM (COL1)
FROM (
	SELECT COUNT(*) COL1
	FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
	WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
	AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
	AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
	AND P1.PROFILE IN  (
		SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
		FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	AND ((P1.LIMIT IS NULL OR P1.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR  (P1.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
												WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
												AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX' 
												AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')))                                                         
	AND ((P2.LIMIT IS NULL OR P2.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P2.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
												WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
												AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
												AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED'))) 
	UNION
	SELECT COUNT(*) COL1
	FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
	WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
	AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
	AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
	AND P1.PROFILE IN  (
		SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
		FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	AND	(
		P1.LIMIT IS NOT NULL AND
		P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' AND
		P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
		P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND 
		(P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT'  OR  EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM 
						    DBA_PROFILES 
						    WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
						    AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME' 
						    AND LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED')) AND
		LENGTH(TRIM(TRANSLATE(P1.LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) IS NULL AND
		LPAD(P1.LIMIT,40,'0') &lt; LPAD(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
		)	
) MYCOUNT</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX current setting:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Profile = ' || P1.PROFILE || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX = ' || P1.LIMIT || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME = ' || P2.LIMIT
FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
AND P1.PROFILE IN  (
	SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
	FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
AND ((P1.LIMIT IS NULL OR P1.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR  (P1.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
                                                              				WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
                                                              				AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX' 
                                                              				AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')))                                                         
AND ((P2.LIMIT IS NULL OR P2.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P2.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
                                                              				WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
                                                              				AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
                                                              				AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED'))) 
UNION
SELECT 'Profile = ' || P1.PROFILE || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX = ' || P1.LIMIT || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME = ' || P2.LIMIT
FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
AND P1.PROFILE IN  (
	SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
	FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
AND	(
	P1.LIMIT IS NOT NULL AND
	P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' AND
	P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
  	P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND 
  	(P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT'  OR  EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM 
  					    DBA_PROFILES 
  					    WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
  					    AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME' 
  					    AND LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED')) AND
	LENGTH(TRIM(TRANSLATE(P1.LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) IS NULL AND
	LPAD(P1.LIMIT,40,'0') &lt; LPAD(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
	)</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT SUM (COL1)
FROM (
	SELECT COUNT(*) COL1
	FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
	WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
	AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
	AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
	AND P2.PROFILE IN  (
		SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
		FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	AND ((P2.LIMIT IS NULL OR P2.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P2.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
												WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
												AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME' 
												AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')))    
	AND ((P1.LIMIT IS NULL OR P1.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P1.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
												WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
												AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
												AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED'))) 
	UNION
	SELECT COUNT(*) COL1
	FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
	WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
	AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
	AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
	AND P2.PROFILE IN  (
		SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
		FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
		ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
		)
	AND	(
		P2.LIMIT IS NOT NULL AND
		P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' AND
		P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
		P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
		(P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT'  OR  EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM 
						    DBA_PROFILES 
						    WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
						    AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX' 
						    AND LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED')) AND    
		LENGTH(TRIM(TRANSLATE(P2.LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) IS NULL AND
		LPAD(P2.LIMIT,40,'0') &lt; LPAD(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
		)
) MYCOUNT</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME current setting:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Profile = ' || P2.PROFILE || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME = ' || P2.LIMIT || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX = ' || P1.LIMIT
FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
AND P2.PROFILE IN  (
	SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
	FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
AND ((P2.LIMIT IS NULL OR P2.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P2.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
											WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
											AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME' 
											AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED')))    
AND ((P1.LIMIT IS NULL OR P1.LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED') OR (P1.LIMIT = 'DEFAULT' AND EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM DBA_PROFILES 
											WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
											AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
											AND LIMIT = 'UNLIMITED'))) 
UNION
SELECT 'Profile = ' || P2.PROFILE || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME = ' || P2.LIMIT || ' : PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX = ' || P1.LIMIT
FROM DBA_PROFILES P1, DBA_PROFILES P2
WHERE P1.PROFILE = P2.PROFILE
AND P1.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX'
AND P2.RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_TIME'
AND P2.PROFILE IN  (
	SELECT DISTINCT PROFILE
	FROM DBA_USERS WHERE
	ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN'
	)
AND	(
	P2.LIMIT IS NOT NULL AND
	P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT' AND
	P2.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
	P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED' AND
	(P1.LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'DEFAULT'  OR  EXISTS (SELECT LIMIT FROM 
					    DBA_PROFILES 
					    WHERE PROFILE = 'DEFAULT' 
					    AND RESOURCE_NAME = 'PASSWORD_REUSE_MAX' 
					    AND LIMIT &lt;&gt; 'UNLIMITED')) AND    
	LENGTH(TRIM(TRANSLATE(P2.LIMIT, ' +-.0123456789', ' '))) IS NULL AND
	LPAD(P2.LIMIT,40,'0') &lt; LPAD(%THRESHOLD%,40,'0')
	)</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="TEST_ID">2312</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">One or more predefined Oracle user accounts have an OPEN status and a default password. These predefined Oracle users and passwords are well-known to anyone familiar with Oracle and represent one of the easiest entry points for attacks and data theft/damage. We recommend that you remove any predefined Oracle user accounts that are not absolutely required and we strongly recommend that you change the default passwords for any of these users who are required.  You can use this example command to alter the password: ALTER USER &lt;USERNAME&gt; IDENTIFIED BY &lt;SECURE_PASSWORD&gt;.  You can optionally lock and expire account that does not require login.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Pre-defined users do not use a default password.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more pre-defined users have a default password.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from dba_users_with_defpwd d, dba_users u
where u.username=d.username
and u.account_status = 'OPEN'</field>

We recommend you to revoke fixed server role assignments from unauthorized users. Grant fixed server roles only to database administrators or authorized grantee, including grantee who executes Guardium vulnerability assessment. If you need to exclude a certain grantee from a fixed server role, you can create an exception group and populate it with the authorized grantee name and the granted fixed server role name, then link your exception group to this test.  To revoke an unauthorized grantee from assigned roles:  EXEC SP_DROPSRVROLEMEMBER [grantee], [granted_role];</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Fixed Server roles have no unauthorized users or groups assigned as members.</field>

     	master.sys.server_principals server_role, 
     	master.sys.server_principals grantee 
WHERE	ro.role_principal_id = server_role.principal_id
      	and ro.member_principal_id = grantee.principal_id
      	and upper(grantee.name) not like 'NT SERVICE\%'
      	and upper(grantee.name) not in ('NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', 'SA')</field>

If you need to exclude certain grantee or objects that must have grant option, you can create an exception group then populate it with authorize grantee and or objects name and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Object privileges are not being granted with the grant option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more object privileges has been granted with the grant option.</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke columns privilege from individual user.  For best practice, it is not good to grant any privileges to individual user. You can use this command to revoke: revoke &lt;privilege&gt; (&lt;Column_name&gt;) on &lt;Table _name&gt; from &lt;grantee&gt;. If you need to exclude certain objects that must be granted to individual user, you can create an exception group, populate it with authorize object name and user name then link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Columns privilege has not been granted to individual user.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Columns privilege has been granted to individual user.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT count(*)
	FROM QSYS2.SYSCOLAUTH cl 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON cl.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  cl.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and cl.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and cl.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and cl.TABLE_SCHEMA &lt;&gt; cl.GRANTEE
        and cl.TABLE_SCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Following columns privilege has been granted to individual user:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Schema=' ||  cl.TABLE_SCHEMA || ' : User ID=' ||  cl.GRANTEE ||   ' : Table_Name=' || cl.TABLE_NAME || ' : Column_name=' || cl.COLUMN_NAME ||  ' : Privilege_Type=' || cl.PRIVILEGE_TYPE 
	FROM QSYS2.SYSCOLAUTH cl 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON cl.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  cl.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and cl.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and cl.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and cl.TABLE_SCHEMA &lt;&gt; cl.GRANTEE
        and cl.TABLE_SCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you review all profiles with *ALLOBJ special authorities on this system. For each user profile and each user in a group profile, carefully evaluate the need for any special authorities. Ensure that only administrative users have *ALLOBJ special authorities. To remove special authorities from a profile, you can use this command: CHGUSRPRF USRPRF(&lt;profile_name&gt;) SPCAUT(*NONE). Please note that some of the profiles may be predefined DB2 for i profiles.  If you would like to exclude them, please use the exception group called: &quot;DB2 for i Profile User Exclusion Group&quot;.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No profiles with *ALLOBJ special authority are found.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more profiles with *ALLOBJ special authorities is found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select COUNT(*) 
FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO
WHERE Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%'
and STATUS &lt;&gt; '*DISABLED'</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">One or more profile with *ALLOBJ special authorities is found:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Profile = ' || tb.Authorization_Name || ' : Profile_Type = ' || CASE WHEN GROUP_ID_NUMBER &gt; 0 THEN 'GROUP' ELSE 'USER' end  
FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO tb
WHERE tb.STATUS &lt;&gt; '*DISABLED' and tb.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%'</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">The QMAXSIGN system value is not set properly. We recommend setting this to 3 attempts.  The default threshold value for this test is 3 attempts, but the test threshold can be adjusted to meet your organization's needs.  You can modify the QMAXSIGN system value by running a command similar to this example: CHGSYSVAL  SYSVAL(QMAXSIGN)  VALUE('3')</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The QMAXSIGN system value is set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The QMAXSIGN system value is set to an unacceptable value.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT count(*)
from sysibmadm.system_value_info 
where system_value_name = 'QMAXSIGN'
and (current_character_value = '*NOMAX' OR CAST(current_character_value AS INT) &gt; %THRESHOLD%)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>

You can use this command to revoke: revoke &lt;privilege&gt; on PACKAGE &lt;Package_Name&gt; from &lt;grantee&gt;. If you need to exclude certain grantee or objects that must have grant option, you can create an exception group then populate it with authorize grantee and or objects name and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Object privileges are not being granted with the grant option, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more object privileges has been granted with the grant option.</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke table and view privileges from individual users.  For best practice, it is not good to grant any privileges to individual users. You can use this command to revoke: revoke &lt;privilege&gt; on &lt;Table_Name&gt; from &lt;grantee&gt;. If you need to exclude certain objects that must be granted to individual users, you can create an exception group, populate it with authorized object names and user names then link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Type privilege has not been granted to individual user.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">Type privilege has been granted to individual user(s).</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT count(*)
	FROM QSYS2.SYSTABAUTH tb 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON tb.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  tb.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and tb.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and tb.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and tb.TABLE_SCHEMA &lt;&gt; tb.GRANTEE
        and tb.TABLE_SCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Following table and view privilege has been granted to individual user(s):</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Schema=' ||  tb.TABLE_SCHEMA || ' : User_ID=' ||  tb.GRANTEE ||   ' : Table_Name=' || tb.TABLE_NAME ||  ' : Privilege_Type=' || tb.PRIVILEGE_TYPE
	FROM QSYS2.SYSTABAUTH tb 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON tb.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  tb.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and tb.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and tb.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and tb.TABLE_SCHEMA &lt;&gt; tb.GRANTEE
        and tb.TABLE_SCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

	from QSYS2.SYSXSROBJECTAUTH tb 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON tb.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  tb.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and tb.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and tb.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and tb.XSROBJECTSCHEMA &lt;&gt; tb.GRANTEE
        and tb.XSROBJECTSCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'Schema=' ||  tb.XSROBJECTSCHEMA || ' : User ID=' ||  tb.GRANTEE ||    ' : XML_Object_Name=' || tb.XSROBJECTNAME ||  ' : Privilege_Type=' || tb.PRIVILEGE_TYPE
	FROM QSYS2.SYSXSROBJECTAUTH tb 
	INNER JOIN Qsys2.Authorizations a ON tb.grantee = a.AUTHORIZATION_NAME
	Where NOT EXISTS
		(SELECT Authorization_Name
		  FROM SYSIBMADM.USER_INFO u
		  where u.Authorization_Name =  tb.grantee and u.Special_Authorities like '%ALLOBJ%')
	and tb.grantee &lt;&gt; 'PUBLIC' 
	and tb.AUTHORIZATION_LIST IS NULL
	and a.AUTHORIZATION_ATTR ='USER'
        and tb.XSROBJECTSCHEMA &lt;&gt; tb.GRANTEE
        and tb.XSROBJECTSCHEMA not in (~~G~DB2 for i exclude system schemas - grant to individual users~~)</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke the SELECT ANY DICTIONARY privilege from unauthorized grantees. You can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE SELECT ANY DICTIONARY FROM &lt;grantee&gt;. To exclude authorized SELECT ANY DICTIONARY Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No unauthorized grantee has been granted 'SELECT ANY DICTIONARY' privilege.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">'SELECT ANY DICTIONARY' privilege has been granted to unauthorized grantee.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM  DBA_SYS_PRIVS PRV
    WHERE  PRV.PRIVILEGE = 'SELECT ANY DICTIONARY'
    AND PRV.GRANTEE NOT IN ('DBA','OEM_MONITOR','OLAP_DBA','DBSNMP','OLAPSYS','ORACLE_OCM','SYSMAN','WMSYS', 'SYSBACKUP', 'SYSDG')
    AND PRV.GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Grantee = ' || prv.grantee || ' : Privilege = ' || prv.privilege from  dba_sys_privs prv
    where  prv.privilege = 'SELECT ANY DICTIONARY'
    AND prv.grantee NOT IN ('DBA','OEM_MONITOR','OLAP_DBA','DBSNMP','OLAPSYS','ORACLE_OCM','SYSMAN','WMSYS', 'SYSBACKUP', 'SYSDG')
    AND prv.GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA')
    order by prv.GRANTEE, prv.PRIVILEGE</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2370</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2370</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke the AUDIT SYSTEM privilege from unauthorized grantees. You can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE AUDIT SYSTEM FROM &lt;grantee&gt;. To exclude authorized AUDIT SYSTEM Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No unauthorized grantee has been granted 'AUDIT SYSTEM' privilege.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">'AUDIT SYSTEM' privilege has been granted to unauthorized grantee.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT count(*) from  dba_sys_privs prv
 where  prv.privilege = 'AUDIT SYSTEM'
 AND prv.grantee NOT IN ('DBA', 'DATAPUMP_IMP_FULL_DATABASE', 'IMP_FULL_DATABASE', 'SYS', 'AUDIT_ADMIN')
 AND prv.GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 'Grantee = ' || prv.grantee || ' : Privilege = ' || prv.privilege from  dba_sys_privs prv
 where  prv.privilege = 'AUDIT SYSTEM'
 AND prv.grantee NOT IN ('DBA', 'DATAPUMP_IMP_FULL_DATABASE', 'IMP_FULL_DATABASE', 'SYS', 'AUDIT_ADMIN')
 AND prv.GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA')
 order by prv.GRANTEE, prv.PRIVILEGE</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>

EXEMPT ACCESS POLICY privilege can allow an unauthorized user to potentially access/change confidential data, this capability should be restricted according to the needs of the organization.  You can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE EXEMPT ACCESS POLICY FROM &lt;grantee&gt;. To exclude authorized EXEMPT ACCESS POLICY Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>

 where  prv.privilege = 'EXEMPT ACCESS POLICY'
 AND prv.grantee NOT IN ('DBA','SYS')

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM DBA_TAB_PRIVS 
WHERE TABLE_NAME = 'SCHEDULER$_CREDENTIAL'
   AND UPPER(GRANTEE) not in ('SYS','DBA')
   AND UPPER(GRANTEE) not in
        (select UPPER(GRANTEE) from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
          where UPPER(GRANTED_ROLE) ='DBA')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>

FROM DBA_TAB_PRIVS 
WHERE TABLE_NAME = 'SCHEDULER$_CREDENTIAL'
   AND UPPER(GRANTEE) not in ('SYS','DBA')
   AND UPPER(GRANTEE) not in
        (select UPPER(GRANTEE) from DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
          where UPPER(GRANTED_ROLE) ='DBA')
   ORDER BY GRANTEE</field>

WHERE PRIVILEGE LIKE '%ANY%'
AND GRANTEE NOT IN
('AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE','DBA','DBSNMP','EXFSYS','EXP_FULL_DATABASE','IMP_FULL_DATABASE','DATAPUMP_IMP_FULL_DATABASE','JAVADEBUGPRIV','MDSYS','OEM_MONITOR','OLAPSYS','OLAP_DBA','ORACLE_OCM','OWB$CLIENT','OWBSYS','SCHEDULER_ADMIN','SPATIAL_CSW_ADMIN_USR','SPATIAL_WFS_ADMIN_USR','SYS','SYSMAN','SYSTEM','WMSYS','APEX_030200','APEX_040000','APEX_040100','APEX_040200','LBACSYS', 'ORDSYS', 'OUTLN', 'AUDIT_ADMIN', 'CTXSYS', 'DVSYS','DV_OWNER', 'DV_REALM_OWNER', 'EM_EXPRESS_ALL', 'GSMADMIN_INTERNAL', 'ORDPLUGINS', 'SYSBACKUP', 'SYSDG', 'XDB')
AND GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE UPPER(GRANTED_ROLE) ='DBA')
ORDER BY GRANTEE, PRIVILEGE</field>

   FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS
where grantee not in ('DBA', 'SYS', 'SYSTEM', 'WKSYS', 'LBACSYS', 'WMSYS', 'OWBSYS', 'CTXSYS', 'SPATIAL_CSW_ADMIN_USR',

   WHERE prv.ADMIN_OPTION='YES' 
   AND prv.GRANTEE NOT IN ('AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE','DBA','OWBSYS', 'SCHEDULER_ADMIN','SYS','SYSTEM','WMSYS', 'DVSYS', 'DV_ACCTMGR', 'LBACSYS', 'SYSKM', 'MDSYS')
   AND prv.GRANTEE NOT IN (SELECT GRANTEE FROM DBA_ROLE_PRIVS WHERE GRANTED_ROLE = 'DBA')
   AND prv.GRANTEE NOT LIKE 'APEX_%'

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke the ACCESSCTRL Authority privilege from unauthorized grantees.  For DB2 internal, you can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE ACCESSCTRL ON SYSTEM FROM &lt;grantee&gt; NOT INCLUDING DEPENDENT PRIVILEGES;  To exclude authorized ACCESSCTRL Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>

		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The ACCESSCTRL Authority privilege has been granted to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE ACCESSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN ACCESSCTRLAUTH = 'c' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN ACCESSCTRLAUTH = 'C' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(ACCESSCTRLAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE ACCESSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE">CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF table is not found in your system.  You need to purchase zSecure Audit for this test to work.</field>

	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN BINDAGENTAUTH = 'b' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN BINDAGENTAUTH = 'B' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(BINDAGENTAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE BINDAGENTAUTH IN ('b', 'B')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>

FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF'</field>

		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN CREATETMTABAUTH = 't' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN CREATETMTABAUTH = 'T' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(CREATETMTABAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE CREATETMTABAUTH IN ('t', 'T')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>

FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES

To exclude authorized RECOVER Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The RECOVER Authority privilege is not granted to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The RECOVER Authority privilege has been granted to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE RECOVERAUTH IN ('r', 'R')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSOPRAUTH IN ('o', 'O'))</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN RECOVERAUTH = 'r' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN RECOVERAUTH = 'R' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(RECOVERAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE RECOVERAUTH IN ('r', 'R')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSOPRAUTH IN ('o', 'O'))</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE">CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF table is not found in your system.  You need to purchase zSecure Audit for this test to work.</field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>

		<field name="TEST_ID">2411</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend you revoke the SYSCTRL Authority privilege from unauthorized grantees.  For DB2 internal, you can use the following command to revoke the privilege:  REVOKE SYSCTRL FROM &lt;grantee&gt; BY ALL.  To exclude authorized SYSCTRL Authority grantees, you can create a group, populate it with authorized grantees and link your group to this test.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">The SYSCTRL Authority privilege is not granted to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">The SYSCTRL Authority privilege has been granted to unauthorized users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN SYSCTRLAUTH = 'c' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN SYSCTRLAUTH = 'C' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(SYSCTRLAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF
WHERE SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      (SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
       FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
       WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A'))</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE">CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF table is not found in your system.  You need to purchase zSecure Audit for this test to work.</field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="TEST_ID">2414</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke tablespace privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.  The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security.  Lower case character means it is a granted by DB2.  For example, u=Use authority.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with tablespace privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with tablespace privileges were found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABSPCAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND USEAUTH IS NOT NULL</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' || RTRIM(GRANTEE) ||
	' : Database = ' ||
	RTRIM(DATABASE) ||	
	' : Tablespace_Name = ' ||
	RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  USEAUTH
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABSPCAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND USEAUTH IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY GRANTEE</field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2415</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2415</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke table and/or view privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes vulnerability.  For DB2 internal syntax, you can use the following command to revoke privilege:  REVOKE ALL ON TABLE &lt;schema&gt;.&lt;name&gt; FROM &lt;orphan_grantee&gt; BY ALL.  The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security.  Lower case character means it is a granted by DB2.  For example, s=select, u=update, i=insert, a=alter, d=delete, r=references, t=trigger and x=index.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with table and/or view privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with table and/or view privileges were found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (SELECTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR UPDATEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INSERTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR ALTERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR DELETEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR REFERENCESAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR TRIGGERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INDEXAUTH IS NOT NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' || RTRIM(GRANTEE) ||
	' : Object_Name = ' ||
	RTRIM(SCHEMA) || '.' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN SELECTAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  SELECTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN UPDATEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  UPDATEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INSERTAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  INSERTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN ALTERAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  ALTERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN DELETEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  DELETEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN REFERENCESAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  REFERENCESAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN TRIGGERAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  TRIGGERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INDEXAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  INDEXAUTH
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (SELECTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR UPDATEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INSERTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR ALTERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR DELETEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR REFERENCESAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR TRIGGERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INDEXAUTH IS NOT NULL) 
ORDER BY GRANTEE</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE">CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF table is not found in your system.  You need to purchase zSecure Audit for this test to work.</field>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke routine privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.  For DB2 internal syntax, you can use the following command to revoke privilege:  REVOKE EXECUTE ON PROCEDURE &lt;schema&gt;.&lt;name&gt; FROM &lt;orphan_grantee&gt; BY ALL RESTRICT;  The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security.  Lower case character means it is a granted by DB2.  For example, d=display and e=execute.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with routine privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with routine privileges were found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSRTNAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (DISPLAYAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR EXECUTEAUTH IS NOT NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' || RTRIM(GRANTEE) ||
	' : Routine = ' ||
	RTRIM(SCHEMA) || '.' || RTRIM(SPEC_NAME) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN DISPLAYAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  RTRIM(DISPLAYAUTH)
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN EXECUTEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  RTRIM(EXECUTEAUTH)
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSRTNAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (DISPLAYAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR EXECUTEAUTH IS NOT NULL)
ORDER BY GRANTEE</field>

FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'

If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.  For DB2 internal syntax, you can use the following command to revoke privilege:  REVOKE BIND,EXECUTE ON PLAN &lt;name&gt; FROM &lt;orphan_grantee&gt;.  The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security.  Lower case character means it is a granted by DB2.  For example, b=bind, e=execute.</field>

	' : Plan_name = ' ||
	RTRIM(NAME) ||

	CASE
	 WHEN BINDAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  BINDAUTH
	END ||

	 WHEN EXECUTEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  EXECUTEAUTH
	END ||

		<field name="TEST_ID">2419</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required.</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Revoke package privileges from the listed orphan grantees.  If an OS user or group with the same name as an orphan grantee is created in the future, he/she will inherit the privileges held by the orphan grantee, and this constitutes a vulnerability.  For DB2 internal syntax, you can use the following command to revoke privilege:  REVOKE EXECUTE ON PACKAGE &lt;collection&gt;.&lt;name&gt; FROM &lt;orphan_grantee&gt; BY ALL.  The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security.  Lower case character means it is a granted by DB2.  For example, b=bind, c=copy and e=execute.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">No orphan grantees exist with package privileges, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more orphan grantees with package privileges were found.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSPKGAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (BINDAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR COPYAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR EXECUTEAUTH IS NOT NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' || RTRIM(GRANTEE) ||
	' : Package = ' ||
	RTRIM(COLLECTION) || '.' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Version = ' || 
	RTRIM(VERSION) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN BINDAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  BINDAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN COPYAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  COPYAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN EXECUTEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  EXECUTEAUTH
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSPKGAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID = '-undef-'
AND (BINDAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR COPYAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR EXECUTEAUTH IS NOT NULL) 
ORDER BY GRANTEE</field>

	 WHEN BINDAUTH IS NULL OR BINDAUTH = '.' THEN ''

	 ELSE  COPYAUTH

AND (SELECTAUTH = 'S' OR UPDATEAUTH = 'U' OR INSERTAUTH = 'I' OR ALTERAUTH = 'A' OR DELETEAUTH = 'D' OR REFERENCESAUTH = 'R' OR TRIGGERAUTH = 'T' OR INDEXAUTH = 'X')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : User = ' || RTRIM(USER_ID) ||
	' : Object_Name = ' ||
	RTRIM(SCHEMA) || '.' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN SELECTAUTH IS NULL OR SELECTAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  SELECTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN UPDATEAUTH IS NULL OR UPDATEAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  UPDATEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INSERTAUTH IS NULL OR INSERTAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  INSERTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN ALTERAUTH IS NULL OR ALTERAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  ALTERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN DELETEAUTH IS NULL OR DELETEAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  DELETEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN REFERENCESAUTH IS NULL OR REFERENCESAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  REFERENCESAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN TRIGGERAUTH IS NULL OR TRIGGERAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  TRIGGERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INDEXAUTH IS NULL OR INDEXAUTH = '.' THEN ''
	 ELSE  INDEXAUTH
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH
WHERE USER_ID = GRANTEE
AND USER_ID NOT IN ('SYSADM','SYSIBM') 
AND (SELECTAUTH = 'S' OR UPDATEAUTH = 'U' OR INSERTAUTH = 'I' OR ALTERAUTH = 'A' OR DELETEAUTH = 'D' OR REFERENCESAUTH = 'R' OR TRIGGERAUTH = 'T' OR INDEXAUTH = 'X')
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL">SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES 
WHERE DBNAME = 'CKADBVA'
AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH'</field>

     OR INDEXAUTH IS NOT NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Object_Name = ' ||
	RTRIM(SCHEMA) || '.' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Privilege = -' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN SELECTAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  SELECTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN UPDATEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  UPDATEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INSERTAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  INSERTAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN ALTERAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  ALTERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN DELETEAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  DELETEAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN REFERENCESAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  REFERENCESAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN TRIGGERAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  TRIGGERAUTH
	END ||
	CASE
	 WHEN INDEXAUTH IS NULL THEN ''
	 ELSE  INDEXAUTH
	END ||
	'-'
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF 
WHERE USER_ID IN  ('-public-', '- any -', '-pubrmt-', '-other-' )
AND (SELECTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR UPDATEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INSERTAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR ALTERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR DELETEAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR REFERENCESAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR TRIGGERAUTH IS NOT NULL
     OR INDEXAUTH IS NOT NULL) 
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>

FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES

AND CREATOR = 'CKADBVA' 
AND NAME = 'CKA_OS_SYSTABAUTH_EFF'</field>

The instruction on how you would interpret privileges displayed in the test detail area is as follows:  Upper case character means it is granted by external security. 		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE CREATETABAUTH IN ('t', 'T')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      	(SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
      	 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
      	 WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C'))
      AND (DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('d', 'D') OR DBADMAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBCTRLAUTH  NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('m', 'M') OR DBMAINTAUTH IS NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Database = ' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN CREATETABAUTH = 't' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN CREATETABAUTH = 'T' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(CREATETABAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE CREATETABAUTH IN ('t', 'T')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      	(SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
      	 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
      	 WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C'))
      AND (DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('d', 'D') OR DBADMAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBCTRLAUTH  NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('m', 'M') OR DBMAINTAUTH IS NULL)
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>

	 WHEN DBMAINTAUTH = 'm' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN DBMAINTAUTH = 'M' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(DBMAINTAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE DBMAINTAUTH IN ('m', 'M')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      	(SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
      	 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
      	 WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C'))
      AND (DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('d', 'D')  OR DBADMAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBCTRLAUTH NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE DISPLAYDBAUTH IN ('d', 'D')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN

      AND (DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('d', 'D') OR DBADMAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBCTRLAUTH  NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('m', 'M') OR DBMAINTAUTH IS NULL)</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">0</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Grantee causing failure:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">SELECT 	'Security_DB = ' || RTRIM(COMPLEX) || 
	' : System_ID = ' || RTRIM(DB2ID) ||
	' : Database = ' || RTRIM(NAME) ||
	' : Grantee = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN DISPLAYDBAUTH = 'd' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN DISPLAYDBAUTH = 'D' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(DISPLAYDBAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE DISPLAYDBAUTH IN ('d', 'D')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      	(SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
      	 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
      	 WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C'))

      AND (DBCTRLAUTH  NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('m', 'M') OR DBMAINTAUTH IS NULL)
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>

	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN RTRIM(GRANTEE)
	 ELSE RTRIM(USER_ID)
	END ||
	' : Grantee_Type = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-undef-' THEN 'ORPHAN'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-public-' THEN 'PUBLIC'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '- any -' THEN 'ALL USERS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-pubrmt-' THEN 'PUBLIC AT ALL LOCATION'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-other-' THEN 'UNIVERSAL ACCESS'
	 WHEN USER_ID = '-unvgrp-'  THEN 'UNIVERSAL GROUP'
	 ELSE 'USER'
	END ||
	' : Access_Control = ' ||
	CASE
	 WHEN REORGAUTH = 'o' THEN 'DB2 Catalog'
	 WHEN REORGAUTH = 'O' THEN 'External security'
	 ELSE RTRIM(REORGAUTH)
	END
FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSDBAUTH_EFF
WHERE REORGAUTH IN ('o', 'O')
      AND RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) NOT IN 
      	(SELECT  RTRIM(USER_ID) || RTRIM(GRANTEE) 
      	 FROM CKADBVA.CKA_OS_SYSUSERAUTH_EFF 
      	 WHERE SYSADMAUTH IN ('a', 'A') OR SYSCTRLAUTH IN ('c', 'C'))
      AND (DBADMAUTH NOT IN ('d', 'D') OR DBADMAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBCTRLAUTH  NOT IN ('c', 'C') OR DBCTRLAUTH IS NULL)
      AND (DBMAINTAUTH NOT IN ('m', 'M') OR DBMAINTAUTH IS NULL)
ORDER BY USER_ID</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">SELECT count(*) FROM DBA_USERS WHERE USERNAME in ('ALLUSERS', 'AOLDEMO', 'AQDEMO', 'AQJAVA', 'AQUSER', 'AUC_GUEST', 'BI', 'CTXDEMO', 'DEMO8', 'DEV2000_DEMOS', 'HR', 'IX', 'OE', 'ORABAMSAMPLES', 'PM', 'PORTAL_DEMO', 'PORTAL30_DEMO', 'QS', 'SCOTT', 'SECDEMO', 'SH', 'WK_TEST') or username like 'QS_%'</field>

		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>

	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2454</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2454</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">Please set your LOCAL_LISTENER to IPC in reducing your exposure to TNS poisoning attack.  You can use the following command to change the setting: alter system set local_listener='(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS= (PROTOCOL=IPC)(KEY=REGISTER)))' scope = both;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">LOCAL_LISTENER parameter is set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">LOCAL_LISTENER parameter is not set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
 	no_such_table exception;
 	l_cnt integer;
 	is_cluster integer := 0;
 	is_exdata integer := 0;
 	is_local_listener_set integer := 0;
 	retval	integer := 0;
 	pragma exception_init( no_such_table, -942 );
 begin
 
 	begin
 		execute immediate 'select count(*) from (select distinct cell_name from gv$cell_state)' 
 		into is_exdata;
 		exception
 		when no_such_table then 
 		is_exdata := 0;		/* if gv$cell_state does not exist, then it could not be Exadata.  This table is seen on 11gR2 and higher */
 	end;				/* it is important that SYS.GV_$CELL_STATE is granted to GDMMONITOR role */
 
  	select count(*) into is_cluster from v$parameter a where upper(name) = 'CLUSTER_DATABASE' and UPPER(value) = 'TRUE';
 
 	select count(*) into is_local_listener_set from v$parameter a where upper(name) = 'LOCAL_LISTENER' and (value is NULL OR VALUE = '' or upper(value) NOT like '%PROTOCOL=IPC%');
 	/*0 is set to IPC, 1 not set*/
 
 	/* if local listner is not set and not exadata and not cluster.  Then fail, else pass.  all other case are pass. */
 	
 	if is_local_listener_set = 1 and  is_cluster = 0 and is_exdata = 0 then
 		retval := 1;		/* test fail */
 	else
 		retval := 0;		/* test pass */
 	end if;
 	
 	? := retval;
 	
 /*
 	dbms_output.put_line(retval || ' retval, 1 = fail, 0 = pass');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_local_listener_set || 'is_remote_listener_set');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_cluster || 'is_cluster');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_exdata || 'is_exdata');
 */

end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">0</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'local_listener = ' || value from v$parameter where upper(name) = 'LOCAL_LISTENER'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>
	<row>
		<field name="SQLBASED_ASSESSMENT_DEFINITION_ID">2455</field>
		<field name="TEST_ID">2455</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_PASS">No action required</field>
		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">REMOTE_LISTENER parameter is not disabled and will potentially allow the spoofing of connection and compromise the data integrity. We recommend to disable the value. You can use the following command to change the setting: alter system set remote_listener='' scope = spfile;</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">REMOTE_LISTENER parameter is set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">REMOTE_LISTENER parameter is not set as recommended.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">declare
 	no_such_table exception;
 	l_cnt integer;
 	is_cluster integer := 0;
 	is_exdata integer := 0;
 	is_remote_listener_set integer := 0;
 	retval	integer := 0;
 	pragma exception_init( no_such_table, -942 );
 begin
 
 	begin
 		execute immediate 'select count(*) from (select distinct cell_name from gv$cell_state)' 
 		into is_exdata;
 		exception
 		when no_such_table then 
 		is_exdata := 0;		/* if gv$cell_state does not exist, then it could not be Exadata.  This table is seen on 11gR2 and higher */
 	end;				/* it is important that SYS.GV_$CELL_STATE is granted to GDMMONITOR role */
 
  	select count(*) into is_cluster from v$parameter a where upper(name) = 'CLUSTER_DATABASE' and UPPER(value) = 'TRUE';
 
 	select count(*) into is_remote_listener_set from v$parameter where upper(name) = 'REMOTE_LISTENER' and value is not NULL;
 
 	/* if remote listner is set and not exadata and not cluster.  Then fail, else pass.  all other case are pass. */
 	
 	if is_remote_listener_set = 1 and  is_cluster = 0 and is_exdata = 0 then
 		retval := 0;		/* test fail */
 	else
 		retval :=1;		/* test pass */
 	end if;
 	
 	? := retval;
 	
 /*
 	dbms_output.put_line(retval || ' retval, 0 = fail, 1 = pass');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_remote_listener_set || 'is_remote_listener_set');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_cluster || 'is_cluster');
 	dbms_output.put_line(is_exdata || 'is_exdata');
 */
 
 end;</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>
		<field name="OPERATOR_ID">8</field>
		<field name="COMPARE_TO_VALUE">1</field>
		<field name="IS_CALLABLE_STATEMENT">1</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT"></field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'remote_listener = ' || value from v$parameter where upper(name) = 'REMOTE_LISTENER'</field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_CHECK_SQL"></field>
		<field name="PRE_TEST_FAIL_MESSAGE"></field>
		<field name="DB_LOOP_FLAG">0</field>
		<field name="LOOP_DATABASES"></field>
	</row>

		<field name="RECOMMENDATION_TEXT_FAIL">We recommend that you grant privileges to groups instead of individual users.  If you must exclude certain grantees from this policy, you can create an exception group and populate it with authorized grantees, and then link your group to this test.  You can remove individual grants via a command similar to this example: REVOKE CREATE ON DATABASE &lt;database_name&gt; FROM &lt;user_name&gt;.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">Database create privileges are not granted directly to individual users, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more database create privilege have been granted directly to users.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from nc_system.nc_all_database_privs priv 
join nc_system.nc_all_databases d on priv.dbid = d.dbid
join nc_system.nc_all_users u on priv.grantee = u.username
where priv.privtype = 'create'
and priv.grantor &lt;&gt; priv.grantee
and priv.grantee not in (select u.username from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid join nc_system.nc_all_users u on  m.memberid = u.userid where r.rolename = 'db_admin')</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Users with direct database create privileges:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'grantee = ' || priv.grantee || ' : grantor = ' || priv.grantor || ' : privilege = ' || priv.privtype || ' : database = ' || d.dbname
from nc_system.nc_all_database_privs priv 
join nc_system.nc_all_databases d on priv.dbid = d.dbid
join nc_system.nc_all_users u on priv.grantee = u.username
where priv.privtype = 'create'
and priv.grantor &lt;&gt; priv.grantee
and priv.grantee not in (select u.username from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid join nc_system.nc_all_users u on  m.memberid = u.userid where r.rolename = 'db_admin')
order by priv.grantee</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid,  
(
select roleid as granteeid,
       rolename as granteename,
       'Role' as granteetype,
       cancreaterole,
       cancreatedb,
       autoinheritgrouppriv
from nc_system.nc_all_roles
union 
select userid as granteeid,
       username as granteename,
       'User' as granteetype,
       cancreaterole,
       cancreatedb,
       autoinheritgrouppriv
from nc_system.nc_all_users
) AS grantee
where
  m.memberid = grantee.granteeid
  and r.rolename = 'amc_admin'
  and grantee.granteename not in (select u.username from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid join nc_system.nc_all_users u on  m.memberid = u.userid where r.rolename = 'db_admin')</field>

You can revoke this type of grant via a command similar to this example: REVOKE &lt;role_granted&gt; FROM &lt;role_name&gt;.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_PASS">A role has not granted to a role, as recommended.</field>
		<field name="RESULT_TEXT_FAIL">One or more roles have been granted to another role.</field>
		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles u on  m.memberid = u.roleid
where u.rolename not in ('amc_admin', 'catalog_admin', 'db_admin', 'node_admin', 'node_viewer', 'process_admin', 'process_runner', 'process_viewer')</field>
		<field name="RETURN_TYPE">I</field>

		<field name="DETAIL_TEXT">Role granted to role:</field>
		<field name="DETAIL_SQL">select 'grantee = ' || u.rolename || ' : role_granted = ' || r.rolename
from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles u on  m.memberid = u.roleid
where u.rolename not in ('amc_admin', 'catalog_admin', 'db_admin', 'node_admin', 'node_viewer', 'process_admin', 'process_runner', 'process_viewer')</field>

		<field name="SQL_STMT">select count(*)
from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m 
join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid,  
(
select roleid as granteeid,
       rolename as granteename,
       'Role' as granteetype,
       cancreaterole,
       cancreatedb,
       autoinheritgrouppriv
from nc_system.nc_all_roles
union 
select userid as granteeid,
       username as granteename,
       'User' as granteetype,
       cancreaterole,
       cancreatedb,
       autoinheritgrouppriv
from nc_system.nc_all_users
) AS grantee
where
  m.memberid = grantee.granteeid
  and r.rolename = 'node_admin'
  and grantee.granteename not in (select u.username from nc_system.nc_all_group_members m join nc_system.nc_all_roles r on m.groupid = r.roleid join nc_system.nc_all_users u on  m.memberid = u.userid where r.rolename = 'db_admin')</field>
